Label: Weakness of facial musculature
Synonyms: Facial weakness|Weakness of face|Decreased strength of facial muscles|Myasthenia of facial muscles|Decreased facial muscle strength|Face weakness|Facial muscle weakness|Reduced facial muscle strength|Weakness of facial musculature
Description: Reduced strength of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

Label: Morphological abnormality of the lateral semicircular canal
Synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the horizontal semicircular canal

Label: Muscular hypotonia
Synonyms: Muscle hypotonia|Low or weak muscle tone
Description: Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching. Muscular hypotonia may be related to defects in skeletal muscle, neuromuscular junction, or peripheral nerve.

Label: Abnormal facial shape
Synonyms: Unusual facies|Distinctive facies|Unusual facial appearance|Abnormal facial shape|Dysmorphic facial features|Dysmorphic facies|Facial dysmorphism|Abnormal morphology of the face
Description: An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components.

Label: Phenotypic abnormality
Description: A phenotypic abnormality.

Label: Abnormal palate morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the palate|Palatal anomaly|Palate abnormality|Abnormality of the roof of the mouth
Description: Any abnormality of the palate, i.e., of roof of the mouth.

Label: Ptosis
Description: The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).

Label: Behavioral abnormality
Synonyms: Behavioral changes|Behavioral disturbances|Behavioural abnormality|Behavioral problems|Behavioral abnormality|Behavioral/psychiatric abnormalities|Behavioural/Psychiatric abnormality|Psychiatric disturbances|Behavioral disorders|Psychiatric disorders
Description: An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities.

Label: Abnormality of the kidney
Synonyms: Abnormality of the kidney|Renal anomaly|Abnormal kidney|Renal anomalies
Description: An abnormality of the kidney.

Label: Brain imaging abnormality
Description: An anomaly of metabolism or structure of the brain identified by imaging.

Label: Facial asymmetry
Synonyms: Facial asymmetry|Crooked face|Asymmetry of face|Asymmetry of right and left side of face|Unsymmetrical face|Asymmetric facies
Description: An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face.

Label: Scoliosis
Description: The presence of an abnormal lateral curvature of the spine.

Label: Abnormality of the cardiovascular system
Synonyms: Cardiovascular abnormality|Abnormality of the cardiovascular system
Description: Any abnormality of the cardiovascular system.

Label: Hearing abnormality
Description: An abnormality of the sensory perception of sound.

Label: Lower cranial nerve dysfunction
Description: A functional abnormality affecting the lower cranial nerves, which include the paired 9th (glossopharyngeal), 10th (vagal), 11th (accessory) and 12th (hypoglossal) cranial nerves.

Label: Mandibular condyle hypoplasia
Synonyms: Decreased size of condylar process of mandible|Small mandibular condyle|Hypoplasia of subcondylar region of mandible|Hypoplasia of condylar process of mandible|Decreased size of mandibular condyle|Hypoplasia of mandibular condyle

Label: Microtia
Synonyms: Hypoplasia of the external ear|Hypoplastic pinna|Bilateral microtia|Small ears|Hypoplastic ears|Small pinnae|Underdeveloped ears
Description: Underdevelopment of the external ear.

Label: Preauricular skin tag
Synonyms: Periauricular skin tag|Preauricular tag|Preauricular tags|Preauricular skin tags|Ear tag|Preauricular fibroepithelial polyp|Preauricular acrochordon
Description: A rudimentary tag of skin often containing ear tissue including a core of cartilage and located just anterior to the auricle (outer part of the ear).

Label: Limbal dermoid
Description: A benign tumor typically found at the junction of the cornea and sclera (limbal epibullar dermoid).

Label: Laterality
Description: The localization with respect to the side of the body of the specified phenotypic abnormality.

Label: Severity
Description: The intensity or degree of a manifestation.

Label: Renal cyst
Description: A fluid filled sac in the kidney.

Label: Neuroblastoma
Description: Neuroblastoma is a solid tumor that originate in neural crest cells of the sympathetic nervous system. Most neuroblastomas originate in the abdomen, and most abdominal neuroblastomas originate in the adrenal gland. Neuroblastomas can also originate in the thorax, usually in the posterior mediastinum.

Label: Craniosynostosis
Synonyms: Cranial suture synostosis|Craniosyostosis|Early fusion of cranial sutures|Premature suture closure|Premature fontanel closure|Premature closure of cranial sutures
Description: Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.

Label: Glioma
Description: The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).

Label: Mediastinal teratoma
Description: A teratoma located within the mediastinum (the cavity between the pleural sacs that contains the heart and all of the thoracic viscera except the lungs).

Label: Vertical orbital dystopia
Synonyms: Misaligned eyes|Unequal eye height|Eyes at different heights
Description: The orbits do not lie on the same horizontal plane, that is, one eye is lower than the other.

Label: Hepatocellular carcinoma
Description: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates in hepatocytes and presents macroscopically as a soft and hemorrhagic tan mass in the liver.

Label: Pectus carinatum
Description: A deformity of the chest caused by overgrowth of the ribs and characterized by protrusion of the sternum.

Label: Talipes equinovarus
Synonyms: Equinovarus|Foot, talipes equinovarus|Club feet|Club foot|Pes equinus|Talipes varus|Clubbing of feet|Clubfeet|Clubfoot|Pes equinovarus
Description: Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.

Label: Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis
Synonyms: Peripheral pulmonic stenosis|Narrowing of peripheral lung artery|peripheral pulmonary stenosis
Description: Stenosis of a peripheral branch of the pulmonary artery.

Label: Ureterocele
Description: A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.

Label: Bifid uvula
Synonyms: Split uvula|Cleft uvula|Bifid palatine uvula|Cleft of uvula|Forked uvula|Uvula bifida
Description: Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.

Label: Osseous finger syndactyly
Description: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

Label: Retractile testis
Description: A testis that is located at the upper scrotum or lower inguinal canal and that can be made to descend completely into the scrotum without resistance by manual reduction but returns to its original position by the cremasteric reflex.

Label: Ankyloglossia
Description: Short or anteriorly attached lingual frenulum, associated with limited mobility of the tongue.

Label: Ectopic anus
Description: Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.

Label: Microphthalmia
Synonyms: Microphthalmos|Abnormally small globe of eye|Abnormally small eyeball
Description: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.

Label: Giant cell tumor of bone
Description: A bone tumor composed of cellular spindle-cell stroma containing scattered multinucleated giant cells resembling osteoclasts.

Label: Cryptorchidism
Description: Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

Label: Unilateral cryptorchidism
Description: Absence of a testis from the scrotum on one side owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

Label: Renal agenesis
Description: Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.

Label: Osteoblastoma
Description: A benign, painful, tumor of bone characterized by the formation of osteoid tissue, primitive bone and calcified tissue.

Label: Biliary atresia
Description: Atresia of the biliary tree.

Label: Pulmonary hypoplasia
Synonyms: Underdeveloped lung|Hypoplastic lungs|Lung hypoplasia|Hypoplastic lung|Small lung

Label: Single umbilical artery
Synonyms: Only one artery in umbilical cord instead of two|Two vessel cord|Two vessel umbilical cord|2 vessel umbilical cord|2 vessel cord
Description: Single umbilical artery (SUA) is the absence of one of the two umbilical arteries surrounding the fetal bladder and in the fetal umbilical cord.

Label: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return
Description: A form of anomalous pulmonary venous return in which not all pulmonary veins drain abnormally. Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return frequently involves one or both of the veins from one lung.

Label: Osteochondroma
Description: A cartilage capped bony outgrowth of a long bone. Osteochondroma arises on the external surface of bone containing a marrow cavity that is continuous with that of the underlying bone.

Label: Plagiocephaly
Synonyms: Rhomboid shaped skull|Flattening of cranial vault|Flat head syndrome|Flattening of skull|Rhomboid shaped cranium|Flattening of cranium
Description: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.

Label: Asplenia
Description: Absence (aplasia) of the spleen.

Label: Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
Description: A tumor that originates in the pineal gland, has moderate cellularity and tends to form rosette patterns.

Label: Secundum atrial septal defect
Synonyms: Patent ostium secundum|Atrial septal defect, ostium secundum type|Ostium secundum atrial septal defect
Description: A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.

Label: Metatarsus adductus
Synonyms: Front half of foot turns inward|Metatarsus adductovarsus|Forefoot varus|Metatarsus varus
Description: The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.

Label: Papule
Description: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

Label: Aortic regurgitation
Description: An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.

Label: Pes valgus
Description: An outward deviation of the foot at the talocalcaneal or subtalar joint.

Label: Syndactyly
Description: Webbing or fusion of the fingers or toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers or toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "symphalangism".

Label: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
Synonyms: Thyroid papillary carcinoma|Papillary carcinoma of thyroid
Description: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

Label: Renal dysplasia
Description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

Label: Pectus excavatum
Description: A defect of the chest wall characterized by a depression of the sternum, giving the chest ("pectus") a caved-in ("excavatum") appearance.

Label: Patent ductus arteriosus
Synonyms: Persistent ductus arteriosus|Ductus arteriosus|Persistent arterial duct
Description: In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.

Label: Melanocytic nevus
Synonyms: Melanocytic nevi|Melanocytic naevus|Nevocellular nevi|Beauty mark|Pigmented naevi|Pigmented nevi
Description: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.

Label: Muscular ventricular septal defect
Description: The trabecular septum is the largest part of the interventricular septum. It extends from the membranous septum to the apex and superiorly to the infundibular septum. A defect in the trabecular septum is called muscular VSD if the defect is completely rimmed by muscle.

Label: Hodgkin lymphoma
Description: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.

Label: Perimembranous ventricular septal defect
Synonyms: Perimembraneous ventricular septal defect|Conoventricular ventricular septal defect|Membranous ventricular septal defect|Paramembranous ventricular septal defect|Type 2 ventricular septal defect
Description: A ventricular septal defect that is confluent with and involves the membranous septum and is bordered by an atrioventricular valve, not including the type 3 VSDs.

Label: Venous malformation
Description: A vascular malformation resulting from a developmental error of venous tissue composed of dysmorphic channels lined by flattened endothelium and exhibiting slow turnover. A venous malformation may present as a blue patch on the skin ranging to a soft blue mass. Venous malformations are easily compressible and usually swell in thewhen venous pressure increases (e.g., when held in a dependent position or when a child cries). They may be relatively localized or quite extensive within an anatomic region.

Label: Hypertelorism
Synonyms: Increased distance between eye sockets|Ocular hypertelorism|Increased interpupillary distance|Wide-set eyes|Widely spaced eyes|Excessive orbital separation|Increased distance between eyes|Widened interpupillary distance
Description: Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes).

Label: Nevus flammeus
Description: A congenital vascular malformation consisting of superficial and deep dilated capillaries in the skin which produce a reddish to purplish discolouration of the skin.

Label: Dermoid cyst
Description: A congenital subcutaneous cyst that arises from entrapment of skin along the lines of embryonic fusion. In contrast to epidermal cysts, dermoid cysts tend to contain various adnexal structures such as hair, sebaceous, eccrine or apocrine glands. Dermoid cysts are present at birth, and are indolent, firm, deep, subcutaneous nodules. They are often located on the head and neck, and rarely in the anogenital area. Dermoid cysts are slowly progressive and can grow to a size of 1 to 4 cm.

Label: Posterior embryotoxon
Description: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.

Label: Pulmonary valve atresia
Description: A congenital disorder of the pulmonary valve in which the orifice of the valve fails to develop.

Label: Anal atresia
Description: Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract.

Label: Excessive femoral anteversion
Description: An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.

Label: Macrocephaly
Synonyms: Large head circumference|Macrocrania|Large head|Increased size of cranium|Megacephaly|Increased size of skull
Description: Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium.

Label: Encephalocele
Description: A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.

Label: Meningioma
Description: The presence of a meningioma, i.e., a benign tumor originating from the dura mater or arachnoid mater.

Label: Myeloid leukemia
Description: A leukemia that originates from a myeloid cell, that is the blood forming cells of the bone marrow.

Label: Nephroblastomatosis
Description: Presence of persistent islands of renal blastema in the postnatal kidney. Nephroblastomatosis represents a complex abnormality of nephrogenesis and has been defined as the persistence of metanephricblastema into infancy and childhood.

Label: Nevus
Description: A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.

Label: Bicuspid aortic valve
Synonyms: Aortic valve has two leaflets rather than three
Description: The presence of an aortic valve with two instead of the normal three cusps (flaps). Bicuspid aortic valvue is a malformation of a commissure (small space between the attachment of each cusp to the aortic wall) and the adjacent parts of the two corresponding cusps forming a raphe (the fused area of the two underdeveloped cusps turning into a malformed commissure between both cusps; the raphe is a fibrous ridge that extends from the commissure to the free edge of the two underdeveloped, conjoint cusps).

Label: Abnormality of the orbital region
Synonyms: Abnormality of the eye region|Abnormality of the region around the eyes

Label: Bilateral microphthalmos
Synonyms: Microphthalmia, bilateral|Abnormally small eyeball on both sides
Description: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.

Label: Unilateral microphthalmos
Synonyms: Abnormally small eyeball on one side
Description: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one eye.

Label: Myelomeningocele
Description: Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.

Label: Bladder exstrophy
Description: Eversion of the posterior bladder wall through the congenitally absent lower anterior abdominal wall and anterior bladder wall.

Label: Patent foramen ovale
Description: Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.

Label: Pulmonary artery stenosis
Description: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

Label: Vascular ring
Description: A developmental defect of the aortic arch system in which the trachea and esophagus are completely encircled by connected segments of the aortic arch and its branches. This occurs if the normal process of regression and persistence of the bilateral embryonic aortic arches fails.

Label: Cortical dysplasia
Description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cerebral cortex.

Label: Craniorachischisis
Description: A neural tube defect in which both the brain and spinal cord remain open to varying degrees.

Label: Horseshoe kidney
Description: A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.

Label: Micropenis
Description: Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.

Label: Right ventricular outlet tract obstruction
Description: An obstruction to the forward flow of blood in the outflow tract of the right ventricle.

Label: Talipes calcaneovalgus
Description: Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an "up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.

Label: Ureteropelvic junction obstruction
Description: Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.

Label: Ependymoma
Description: The presence of an ependymoma of the central nervous system.

Label: Primum atrial septal defect
Synonyms: Primum atrioventricular canal defect|Septum primum defect|Ostium primum atrial septal defect|Atrial septal defect, primum type
Description: An ostium primum atrial septal defect is located in the most anterior and inferior aspect of the atrial septum. The ostium primum refers to an anterior and inferior opening (ostium) within the septum primum, which divides the rudimentary atrium during fetal development. The ostium primum is normally sealed by fusion of the superior and inferior endocardial cushions around 5 weeks' gestation. Ostium primum defects result from a failure of the fusion of the embryologic endocardial cushion and septum primum.

Label: Skeletal dysplasia
Description: A general term describing features characterized by abnormal development of bones and connective tissues.

Label: Gray matter heterotopia
Synonyms: Grey matter heterotopia|Heterotopias|Neuronal heterotopia|Gray matter heterotopias|Heterotopia
Description: Heterotopia or neuronal heterotopia are macroscopic clusters of misplaced neurons (gray matter), most often situated along the ventricular walls or within the subcortical white matter.

Label: Thyroid carcinoma
Description: The presence of a carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

Label: Unilateral cleft lip
Synonyms: Unilateral cheiloschisis|Unilateral cleft upper lip|One sided cleft upper lip
Description: A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on one side only.

Label: Pulmonic stenosis
Synonyms: Pulmonic valve stenosis|Pulmonary stenosis|Narrowing of pulmonic valve|Pulmonary valve stenosis
Description: A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis) or just below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis).

Label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the breasts
Description: Absence or underdevelopment of the breasts.

Label: Genu valgum
Synonyms: Genu valga|Knee joint valgus deformity|Knock knees|Genu valgus|Genua valga
Description: The legs angle inward, such that the knees are close together and the ankles far apart.

Label: Tibial bowing
Synonyms: Bowing of the tibia|Bowed shinbone|Bowed tibia|Bowed shankbone
Description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the tibia.

Label: Spondylolisthesis
Synonyms: Spondylolithesis|Slipped backbone|Displacement of one backbone compared to another
Description: Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the vertebra.

Label: Scaphocephaly
Description: Scaphocephaly is a subtype of dolichocephaly where the anterior and posterior aspects of the cranial vault are pointed (boat-shaped). Scaphocephaly is caused by a precocious fusion of sagittal suture without other associated synostosis.

Label: Bilateral talipes equinovarus
Synonyms: Bilateral clubfeet|Bilateral clubfoot|Club foot on both sides
Description: Bilateral clubfoot deformity (see HP:0001762).

Label: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
Synonyms: Total anomalous pulmonary venous connection|Total anomalous pulmonary venous drainage
Description: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.

Label: Renal cell carcinoma
Synonyms: Hypernephroma|Cancer starting in small tubes in kidneys|Renal carcinoma
Description: A type of carcinoma of the kidney with origin in the epithelium of the proximal convoluted renal tubule.

Label: Pancreas divisum
Description: A congenital anomaly of the pancreas that results from failed fusion of the dorsal and ventral ducts during embyological development. Three variants have been described: type 1 or classical divisum in which there is total failure of fusion; type 2 in which dorsal drainage is dominant in the absence of the duct of Wirsung; and type 3 or incomplete divisum where a small communicating branch is present.

Label: Cutaneous syndactyly of toes
Synonyms: Webbed skin of toes|Cutaneous syndactyly of feet|soft tissue syndactyly of toes
Description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between adjacent foot digits that involves at least half of the proximodistal length of one of the two involved digits; or, a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits of the foot that does not meet the prior objective criteria.

Label: Hip dysplasia
Description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the hip.

Label: Hip subluxation
Synonyms: Partial hip dislocation|Subluxation involving the hip joint
Description: A partial dislocation of the hip joint, whereby the head of the femur is partially displaced from the socket.

Label: Trigonocephaly
Synonyms: Wedge shaped skull|Wedge shaped cranium|Triangular cranium shape|Triangular skull shape
Description: Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.

Label: Osseous syndactyly of toes
Description: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual bones of the toes. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a tibial-fibular axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

Label: Coronal hypospadias
Description: A mild form of hypospadias in which the urethra opens just under the corona glandis.

Label: Single ventricle
Description: The presence of only one working lower chamber in the heart, usually with a virtual absence of the ventricular septum and usually present in conjunction with double inlet left or right ventricle.

Label: Septo-optic dysplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve and absence of the septum pellucidum.

Label: Preauricular cyst
Description: Preauricular sinus is an occasional finding and most frequently appears as a small pit close to the anterior margin of the ascending portion of the helix. The opening has also been reported along the postero superior margin of the helix, the tragus or the lobule. Preauricular sinus may lead to the formation of a subcutaneous cyst that is intimately related to the tragal cartilage and the anterior crus of the helix.

Label: Palmoplantar keratoderma
Synonyms: Thickening of palms and soles|Palmar and plantar keratoderma
Description: Abnormal thickening of the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.

Label: Epidermal nevus
Description: Epidermal naevi are due to an overgrowth of the epidermis and may be present at birth (50%) or develop during childhood.

Label: Neoplasm of the oral cavity
Description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the oral cavity.

Label: Metaphyseal dysplasia
Description: The presence of dysplastic regions in metaphyseal regions.

Label: Germinoma
Description: A type of undifferentiated germ cell tumor that may be benign or malignant.

Label: Penile hypospadias
Description: Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.

Label: Cystic renal dysplasia
Synonyms: Renal dysplasia, cystic|Renal cystic dysplasia|Bilateral cystic dysplasia

Label: Neoplasm of the posterior pituitary
Description: The presence of a neoplasm (tumour) in the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.

Label: Premature closure of fontanelles
Synonyms: Early closure of the fontanelles|Obliterated fontanelles
Description: Normally, the posterior and lateral fontanelles are obliterated by about six months after birth, the anterior fontanelle closes by about the middle of the second year. This term refers to the situation in which the fontanelles close at an inappropriately early time point.

Label: Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle
Synonyms: Later than typical closing of soft spot of skull|Delayed closure anterior fontanel|Late closure of the bregma sutures|Persistent anterior fontanelle|Delayed closure of the bregma sutures|Late closure of large anterior fontanel|Delayed closure of anterior fontanelle|Late closure of anterior fontanelle
Description: A delay in closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.

Label: Balanced double aortic arch
Description: A type of double aortic arch in which the two branches are of equal size. In most cases of double aortic arch, the right aortic arch is larger and located higher than the left aortic arch.

Label: Sagittal craniosynostosis
Synonyms: Craniosynostosis, sagittal suture|Sagittal suture synostosis|Midline skull joint closes early|Craniosynostosis, sagittal|Early closure of midline skull joint
Description: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.

Label: Pilomatrixoma
Description: Pilomatricoma is an asymptomatic slowly growing benign cutaneous tumor, differentiating towards the hair matrix of the hair follicle. It is covered by normal or hyperemic skin, and usually varies in size from 0.5 to 3 cm.

Label: Congenital extraocular muscle anomaly
Description: Congenital abnormality of the extraocular muscles.

Label: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries
Description: The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta.

Label: Talipes valgus
Description: Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.

Label: Cryptophthalmos
Description: Cryptophthalmos is a condition of total absence of eyelids and the skin of forehead is continuous with that of cheek, in which the eyeball is completely concealed by the skin, which is stretched over the orbital cavity.

Label: Hypospadias
Description: Abnormal position of urethral meatus on the ventral penile shaft (underside) characterized by displacement of the urethral meatus from the tip of the glans penis to the ventral surface of the penis, scrotum, or perineum.

Label: Double outlet right ventricle
Description: Double outlet right ventricle (DORV) is a type of ventriculoarterial connection in which both great vessels arise entirely or predominantly from the right ventricle.

Label: Pleuropulmonary blastoma
Description: A rare cancer originating in the lung or pleural cavity that occurs most often in infants and young children but also has been reported in adults. Pleuropulmonary blastoma is regarded as malignant.

Label: Glioblastoma multiforme
Description: A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.

Label: Tricuspid atresia
Description: Failure to develop of the tricuspid valve and thus lack of the normal connection between the right atrium and the right ventricle.

Label: Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract
Synonyms: Genitourinary tract neoplasm|Neoplasm of the GU tract|Genitourinary tract tumors
Description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genitourinary system.

Label: Synovial sarcoma
Description: A type of mesenchymal tissue cell tumor that exhibits epithelial differentiation, which most frequently arises in the extremities.

Label: Brainstem glioma
Description: A glioma affecting the brainstem.

Label: Microphallus
Description: Length of penis more than 2 SD below the mean for age accompanied by hypospadias.

Label: Tetralogy of Fallot with pulmonary atresia
Description: An extreme form of tetralogy of Fallot characterized by absence of flow from the right ventricle to the pulmonary arteries.

Label: Double outlet right ventricle with doubly committed ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis
Synonyms: DORV with doubly committed VSD and pulmonary stenosis
Description: A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventritricular septal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and are closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

Label: Penoscrotal hypospadias
Description: A severe form of hypospadias in which the urethral opening is located at the junction of the penis and scrotum.

Label: Fibroma
Description: Benign tumors that are composed of fibrous or connective tissue. They can grow in all organs, arising from mesenchyme tissue. The term "fibroblastic" or "fibromatous" is used to describe tumors of the fibrous connective tissue. When the term fibroma is used without modifier, it is usually considered benign, with the term fibrosarcoma reserved for malignant tumors.

Label: Transitional atrioventricular canal defect
Description: A specific combination of heart defects with a primum atrial septal defect, cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet, and an inlet ventricular septal defect. There are two valve annuli and two valve orifices.

Label: Abdominal situs inversus
Description: A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the viscera of the abdomen.

Label: Abnormality of female external genitalia
Description: An abnormality of the female external genitalia.

Label: Pituitary adenoma
Description: A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis.

Label: Multiple exostoses
Description: Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

Label: Ovarian teratoma
Description: The presence of a teratoma in the ovary.

Label: Bilateral cleft lip
Synonyms: Both sided cleft lip|Bilateral cheiloschisis|Right and left cleft lip
Description: A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on the left and right sides.

Label: Omphalocele
Description: A midline anterior incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which there is herniation of the abdominal viscera into the base of the abdominal cord.

Label: Duodenal atresia
Synonyms: Absence or narrowing of first part of small bowel
Description: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the duodenal lumen, that is, an abnormal closure of the duodenum.

Label: Double inlet left ventricle
Description: The condition in which both atria are joined to the left ventricle each by its own atrioventricular valve. Usually there is a hypoplastic right ventricle, which may be on the opposite side of the heart as usual.

Label: Gonadoblastoma
Description: The presence of a gonadoblastoma, a neoplasm of a gonad that consists of aggregates of germ cells and sex cord elements.

Label: Meningocele
Description: Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the vertebral column.

Label: Unbalanced atrioventricular canal defect
Description: Anatomic features of unbalanced atrioventricular septal defect (AVSD) include varying amounts of ventricular hypoplasia, as well as malalignment of the atrioventricular junction. In complete AVSD, the common AV valve can be situated either equally over the right and left ventricles (balanced) or unequally over the ventricles (unbalanced).

Label: Submucous cleft soft palate
Synonyms: Submucous cleft velum|Partial thickness cleft soft palate
Description: A cleft of the muscular (soft) portion of the palate that is covered by mucous membrane. Soft-palate submucous clefts are characterized by a midline deficiency or lack of muscle tissue.

Label: Soft tissue sarcoma
Description: A type of sarcoma (A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells) that develops from soft tissues like fat, muscle, nerves, fibrous tissues, blood vessels, or deep skin tissues.

Label: Ewing sarcoma
Description: A malignant tumor of the bone which always arises in the medullary tissue, occurring more often in cylindrical bones.

Label: Persistent left superior vena cava
Description: A rare congenital vascular anomaly that results when the left superior cardinal vein caudal to the innominate vein fails to regress.

Label: Myeloproliferative disorder
Description: Proliferation (excess production) of hemopoietically active tissue or of tissue which has embryonic hemopoietic potential.

Label: Restrictive ventricular septal defect
Description: Any ventricular septal defect (VSD) that is small enough to restrict flow across it such that a pressure gradient exists between the two sides of the VSD.

Label: Spondylolysis
Description: Spondylolysis is an osseous defect of the pars interarticularis, thought to be a developmental or acquired stress fracture secondary to chronic low-grade trauma.

Label: Hypoplastic left heart
Synonyms: Left ventricular hypoplasia|Underdeveloped left heart|Heart left ventricle hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the left side of the heart. May include atresia of the aortic or mitral orifice and hypoplasia of the ascending aorta.

Label: Spinal dysraphism
Synonyms: Incomplete closure of the vertebral arch
Description: A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.

Label: Dandy-Walker malformation
Description: A congenital brain malformation typically characterized by incomplete formation of the cerebellar vermis, dilation of the fourth ventricle, and enlargement of the posterior fossa. In layman's terms, Dandy Walker malformation is a cyst in the cerebellum (typically symmetrical) that is involved with the fourth ventricle. This may interfere with the ability to drain cerebrospinal fluid from the brain, resulting in hydrocephalus. Dandy Walker cysts are formed during early embryonic development, while the brain forms. The cyst in the cerebellum typically has several blood vessels running through it connecting to the brain, thereby prohibiting surgical removal.

Label: Dextrocardia
Synonyms: Thoracic situs inversus|Heart tip and four chambers point towards right side of body
Description: The heart is located in the right hand sided hemithorax. That is, there is a left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the heart in which the heart is locate on the right side instead of the left.

Label: Heterotaxy
Description: An abnormality in which the internal thoraco-abdominal organs demonstrate abnormal arrangement across the left-right axis of the body.

Label: Incomplete cleft of the upper lip
Synonyms: Forme fruste unilateral cleft lip|Incomplete cheiloschisis|Partial cleft of the upper lip|Incomplete cleft of the upper lip|Notched cleft of the upper lip
Description: A subtle unilateral cleft of the upper lip, which may appear as a small indentation.

Label: Schwannoma
Description: A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.

Label: Ectopic kidney
Synonyms: Renal ectopia|Abnormal kidney location|Ectopic kidneys|Displaced kidney
Description: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.

Label: Subglottic hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the airway, typically below the vocal chords, that can cause severe obstruction of the airway.

Label: Neoplasm of the endocrine system
Description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the endocrine system.

Label: Increased femoral torsion
Description: Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degress at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion exceeds this range.

Label: Abnormality of the uterine cervix
Description: An anomaly of the neck of the uterus (lower part of the uterus), called the uterine cervix.

Label: Atypical nevus
Description: A large pigmented lesion measuring 5-15 mm in diameter with irregular, notched, and ill defined border and with color that may range from tan to dark brown to pink.

Label: Medullary thyroid carcinoma
Description: The presence of a medullary carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

Label: Ganglioneuroma
Description: A benign neoplasm that usually arises from the sympathetic trunk in the mediastinum, representing a tumor of the sympathetic nerve fibers arising from neural crest cells.

Label: Craniofacial dysostosis
Description: A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.

Label: Neurofibromas
Description: The presence of multiple cutaneous neurofibromas.

Label: Pierre-Robin sequence
Synonyms: Robin sequence|Pierre-robin malformation|Pierre-robin deformity|Pierre-robin anomaly|Pierre Robin sequence
Description: Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.

Label: Teratoma
Description: The presence of a teratoma.

Label: Cystic hygroma
Description: A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck.

Label: Schizencephaly
Description: The presence of a cleft in the cerebral cortex unilaterally or bilaterally, usually located in the frontal area.

Label: Nephroblastoma
Description: The presence of a nephroblastoma, which is a neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children.

Label: Transient myeloproliferative syndrome
Synonyms: Transient leukemia of Down syndrome|TMD|Transient myeloproliferative disorder
Description: A unique clonal neoplastic disorder that is linked to trisomy 21, is restricted to neonatal period, and spontaneously regresses. It often has characteristics of megakaryocytic lineage and is associated with GATA1 mutations in myeloblasts.

Label: Sacral dimple
Description: A cutaneous indentation resulting from tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) of the intergluteal cleft.

Label: Epispadias
Description: Displacement of the urethral opening on the dorsal (superior) surface of the penis.

Label: Cleft palate
Synonyms: Cleft of palate|Cleft hard and soft palate|Cleft palate|Cleft of hard and soft palate|Cleft roof of mouth|Palatoschisis|Uranostaphyloschisis
Description: Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the palate resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).

Label: Esophageal diverticulum
Description: The presence of a diverticulum of the esophagus.

Label: Cutis laxa
Synonyms: Elastolysis|Inelastic skin|Chalazoderma|Skin laxity|Loose skin|Cutaneous laxity|Dermatomegaly|Generalized elastolysis|Dermatochalasia|Loose and inelastic skin|Hypoelastic skin|Lax skin
Description: Wrinkled, redundant, inelastic and sagging skin.

Label: Squamous cell carcinoma
Description: The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin.

Label: Cutaneous mastocytosis
Description: Multifocal dense infiltrates of mast cells in cutaneous tissue.

Label: Mastocytosis
Description: The presence of an increased number of mast cells and CD34+ mast cell precursors in the body.

Label: Ossifying fibroma
Description: A benign central bone tumor composed of fibrous connective tissue within which bone is formed.

Label: Neoplasm of the large intestine
Description: The presence of a neoplasm of the large intestine.

Label: Unilateral renal agenesis
Synonyms: Absent kidney on one side|Missing one kidney|Unilateral kidney agenesis|Single kidney
Description: A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

Label: Bilateral renal hypoplasia
Description: Two sided hypoplasia of the kidney.

Label: Unilateral renal hypoplasia
Synonyms: Underdeveloped kidney on one side|Small kidney on one side
Description: One sided hypoplasia of the kidney.

Label: Nephrolithiasis
Description: The presence of calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

Label: Renal hypoplasia
Description: Hypoplasia of the kidney.

Label: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
Description: A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity

Label: Key ID HP_0000078  may be badly formatted.
Key ID HP_0030038; may be badly formatted.
Hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma is a benign tumor characterized by blood-filled spaces lined by benign endothelial cells. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma (in contrast to a hemangioma with small endothelial spaces, which is called capillary hemangioma).

Label: Enchondroma
Description: A solitary, benign, intramedullary cartilage tumor that is often found in the short tubular bones of the hands and feet, distal femur, and proximal humerus.

Label: Short stature
Synonyms: Stature below 3rd percentile|Short stature|Small stature|Decreased body height|Height less than 3rd percentile
Description: A height below that which is expected according to age and gender norms. Although there is no universally accepted definition of short stature, many refer to "short stature" as height more than 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender (or below the 3rd percentile for age and gender dependent norms).

Label: Abnormality of dental enamel
Description: An abnormality of the dental enamel.

Label: Acromesomelia
Description: Small hands and feet.

Label: Abnormal sternum morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the sternum|Pectus excavatum/carinatum|Pectus deformities|Pectus excavatum or carinatum|Pectus carinatum or pectus excavatum|Pectus excavatum or pectus carinatum|Pectus deformity|Sternal anomalies
Description: An anomaly of the sternum, also known as the breastbone.

Label: Brachydactyly
Description: Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used here to describe a series distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here.

Label: Wide nasal bridge
Synonyms: Increased width of nasal bridge|Widened nasal bridge|Broadened nasal bridge|Nasal bridge broad|Broad nasal bridge|Increased breadth of bridge of nose|Nasal bridge, wide|Increased width of bridge of nose|Broad nasal root|Wide bridge of nose|Wide nasal bridge|Increased breadth of nasal bridge
Description: Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root).

Label: Epicanthus
Synonyms: Eye folds|Prominent eye folds|Plica palpebronasalis|Epicanthal folds|Epicanthal fold|Palpebronasal fold|Epicanthic folds
Description: A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

Label: Exostoses
Synonyms: Formation of new noncancerous bone on top of existing bone
Description: An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

Label: Short attention span
Synonyms: Problem paying attention|Poor attention span|Short attention span
Description: Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

Label: Kyphosis
Description: Exaggerated anterior convexity of the thoracic vertebral column.

Label: Abnormal nasal morphology
Synonyms: Abnormal of nasal shape|Abnormal nose morphology|Abnormal of morphology of nose|Abnormal of shape of nose

Label: Rhizomelia
Synonyms: Rhizomelic short stature|Disproportionately short upper portion of limb|Symmetrical rhizomelic limb shortening|Short stature, rhizomelic|Rhizomelic shortening|Rhizomelic dwarfism|Rhizomelic limb shortening|Rhizomelic short limbs
Description: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of limbs (i.e. the femur and humerus).

Label: Achalasia
Description: A disorder of esophageal motility characterized by the inability of the lower esophageal sphincter to relax during swallowing and by inadequate or lacking peristalsis in the lower half of the body of the esophagus.

Label: Clinodactyly of the 5th finger
Synonyms: Fifth finger clinodactyly|Clinodactyly of fifth digit|Bilateral fifth finger clinodactyly|Clinodactyly of the little finger|Bilateral fifth digit clinodactyly|Permanent curving of the pinkie finger
Description: Clinodactyly refers to a bending or curvature of the fifth finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).

Label: Asymmetry of the thorax
Description: Lack of symmetry between the left and right halves of the thorax.

Label: Lower limb asymmetry
Synonyms: Left and right leg differ in length or width
Description: A difference in length or diameter between the left and right leg.

Label: Conical tooth
Synonyms: Peg-shaped teeth|Shark tooth|Peg tooth|Cone shaped tooth|Peg shaped teeth|Conoid tooth
Description: An abnormal conical form of the teeth, that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.

Label: Childhood-onset short-trunk short stature
Synonyms: Disproportionate short-trunk short stature, identifiable in childhood|Childhood-onset short-trunk short stature|Short-trunk dwarfism identifiable during childhood
Description: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs with onset in childhood.

Label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the hand
Synonyms: Hypoplastic/absent phalanges|Aplastic/hypoplastic phalanges|Aplastic/hypoplastic phalanges of the hand
Description: Small or missing phalangeal bones of the fingers of the hand.

Label: Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Frontal bossing
Description: Bilateral bulging of the lateral frontal bone prominences with relative sparing of the midline.

Label: Rib fusion
Description: Complete or partial merging of adjacent ribs.

Label: Abnormality of the ilium
Description: An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis.

Label: Microdontia
Description: Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.

Label: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
Description: Abnormal morphology of vertebral body.

Label: Platyspondyly
Synonyms: Flattened vertebral bodies|Flattened vertebrae|Flat vertebral bodies
Description: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates.

Label: Agenesis of permanent teeth
Synonyms: Absence of permanent teeth|Agenesis of secondary dentition|Agenesis of permanent dentition|Failure of development of permanent teeth|Absent permanent teeth|Failure of development of secondary teeth|Missing teeth
Description: A congenital defect characterized by the absence of one or more permanent teeth, including oligodontia, hypodontia, and adontia of the of permanent teeth.

Label: Short neck
Synonyms: Cervical shortening|Decreased cervical length|Decreased length of neck|Short neck|Decreased cervical height
Description: Diminished length of the neck.

Label: Strabismus
Description: A misalignment of the eyes so that the visual axes deviate from bifoveal fixation. The classification of strabismus may be based on a number of features including the relative position of the eyes, whether the deviation is latent or manifest, intermittent or constant, concomitant or otherwise and according to the age of onset and the relevance of any associated refractive error.

Label: Facial hemangioma
Description: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the face.

Label: Arterial tortuosity
Description: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of arteries.

Label: Abnormal carotid artery morphology
Description: Any structural abnormality of the carotid arteries, including the common carotid artery and its' arterial branches.

Label: Arterial stenosis
Description: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of an artery.

Label: Abnormality of the cerebral vasculature
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral blood vessels

Label: Laryngeal hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the glottic or supraglottic regions.

Label: Cerebellar hypoplasia
Synonyms: Congenital cerebellar hypoplasia|Underdeveloped cerebellum|Small cerebellum|Hypoplasia of cerebellum|Hypoplastic cerebellum
Description: Underdevelopment of the cerebellum.

Label: Coarctation of aorta
Synonyms: Aortic coarctation|Narrowing of the aorta|Narrowing of aorta|Coarctation of the aorta
Description: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.

Label: Aortic aneurysm
Synonyms: Bulge in wall of large artery that carries blood away from heart|Aortic dilatation
Description: Aortic dilatation refers to a dimension that is greater than the 95th percentile for the normal person age, sex and body size. In contrast, an aneurysm is defined as a localized dilation of the aorta that is more than 150 percent of predicted (ratio of observed to expected diameter 1.5 or more). Aneurysm should be distinguished from ectasia, which represents a diffuse dilation of the aorta less than 50 percent of normal aorta diameter.

Label: Supraumbilical raphe
Description: An abnormality of the sternum that presents at birth as a ventral sternal non-union defect, due to an abnormality of the fusion of the layers of the skin. It presents as a scar-like line that extends upward from the umbilicus (belly button).

Label: Bifid sternum
Description: The sternal cleft is a rare congenital anomaly resulting from a fusion failure of the sternum.

Label: Hearing impairment
Description: A decreased magnitude of the sensory perception of sound.

Label: Sternal pit
Description: A sternal pit is a small indentation or dimple in the skin overlying the sternum of the chest. In some cases, the skin defect can be linear, extending several inches over the sternum.

Label: Intrathoracic hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the intrathoracic or chest region.

Label: Absent sternal ossification
Synonyms: Absent sternal mineralization|Lack of sternal ossification
Description: Lack of formation of mineralized bony tissue of the sternum.

Label: Supraglottic hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the upper part of the larynx (voice box) including the epiglottis; the area above the vocal cords.

Label: Ventricular septal defect
Synonyms: Hole in heart wall separating two lower heart chambers|Ventriculoseptal defect|Ventricular septal defects
Description: A hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart. The defect is centered around the most superior aspect of the ventricular septum.

Label: Aortic tortuosity
Description: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the aorta.

Label: Optic nerve hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve.

Label: Cerebellar vermis hypoplasia
Synonyms: Cerebellar vermal hypoplasia|Hypoplasia of the cerebellar vermis|Hypoplastic cerebellar vermis
Description: Underdevelopment of the vermis of cerebellum.

Label: Sensorineural hearing impairment
Synonyms: Sensorineural deafness|Sensorineural hearing loss|Hearing loss, sensorineural
Description: A type of hearing impairment in one or both ears related to an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve.

Label: Small pituitary gland
Description: An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland.

Label: Esophageal hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the esophagus.

Label: Right aortic arch
Description: Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.

Label: Cerebellar glioma
Description: A glioma affecting the cerebellum.

Label: Pituitary gland cyst
Description: A fluid-filled sacs that develop on or near the pituitary gland.

Label: Conductive hearing impairment
Synonyms: Conductive deafness|Conduction deafness|Hearing loss, conductive|Conductive hearing loss
Description: An abnormality of vibrational conductance of sound to the inner ear leading to impairment of sensory perception of sound.

Label: Hepatic hemangioma
Description: A congenital vascular malformation in the liver composed of masses of blood vessels that are atypical or irregular in arrangement and size.

Label: Cutaneous cyst
Description: A hollow mass located in the skin that is surrounded by an epithelium-lined wall and is well demarcated from the adjacent tissue. Cysts are often said to be sac-like and may contain serous liquid or semisolid material.

Label: Spleen hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the spleen.

Label: Tetralogy of Fallot
Description: A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.

Label: Optic atrophy
Description: Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.

Label: Cerebral atrophy
Description: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the cerebrum.

Label: Hypoplasia of the brainstem
Synonyms: Hypoplastic brainstem|Hypoplastic brain stem|Underdeveloped brainstem|Small brainstem|Brainstem hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the brainstem.

Label: Aortic root aneurysm
Synonyms: Increased aortic root diameter|Bulge in wall of root of large artery that carries blood away from heart
Description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic root.

Label: Atrophic pituitary gland
Description: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of the pituitary gland.

Label: Dilatation of the cerebral artery
Description: The presence of a localized dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.

Label: Cerebellar dysplasia
Description: The presence of dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) of the cerebellum. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome.

Label: Atrial septal defect
Synonyms: ASD|Hole in heart wall separating two upper heart chambers|Atria septal defect|Defect in the atrial septum|An opening in the wall separating the top two chambers of the heart|Atrial septum defect
Description: Atrial septal defect (ASD) is a congenital abnormality of the interatrial septum that enables blood flow between the left and right atria via the interatrial septum.

Label: Retropharyngeal hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the retropharyngeal space, the portion of the peripharyngeal space that is located posterior to the pharynx.

Label: Abnormal cerebellum morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebellum|Cerebellar abnormalities|Cerebellar signs|Cerebellar anomaly|Cerebellar abnormality
Description: Any structural abnormality of the cerebellum.

Label: Double aortic arch
Description: A conenital abnormality of the aortic arch in which the two embryonic aortc arches form a vascular ring that surrounds the trachea or esophagus and then join to form the descending aorta. Double aortic arch can cause symptoms because of compression of the esophagus (dysphagia, cyanosis while eating) or trachea (stridor).

Label: Interrupted aortic arch
Description: Non-continuity of the arch of aorta with an atretic point or absent segment.

Label: Visceral hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma arising from within visceral structures, the internal organs of the body.

Label: Skin tags
Description: Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumours that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region.

Label: Ascending tubular aorta aneurysm
Synonyms: Dilatation of ascending aorta|Aneurysm of the ascending tubular aorta|Ascending aortic aneurysm|Ascending aortic dilation|Bulging of wall of large artery located above heart
Description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the tubular part of the ascending aorta.

Label: Polymicrogyria
Description: Polymicrogyria is a congenital malformation of the cerebral cortex characterized by abnormal cortical layering (lamination) and an excessive number of small gyri (folds).

Label: Intestinal hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the intestines, which includes the bowel.

Label: Paraspinal hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the paraspinal muscular region, the muscles next to the spine.

Label: Vulvar hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the vulva.

Label: Perineal hemangioma
Description: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, located in the perineal region, i.e., the region between the anus and the genitals.

Label: Cerebral hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the cerebrum.

Label: Lumbosacral hemangioma
Description: A spinal cord hemangioma located in the lumbosacral spine region.

Label: Abnormality of the optic nerve
Description: Abnormality of the optic nerve.

Label: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
Synonyms: Congenital retinal septum|Persistent hyperplastic primary vitreous|Persistent fetal vasculature|Persistent hypertrophic primary vitreous|Persistent tunica vasculosa lentis|Persistent posterior fetal fibrovascular sheath of the lens|Persistent hyperplasia of primary vitreous
Description: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.

Label: Labial hemangioma
Description: A hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, that is located in the upper lip.

Label: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
Description: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.

Label: Abnormal heart morphology
Synonyms: Congenital heart defect|Cardiac abnormality|Abnormality of cardiac morphology|Cardiac anomalies|Abnormally shaped heart|Heart defect|Cardiac anomaly|Congenital heart defects|Abnormality of the heart
Description: Any structural anomaly of the heart.

Label: Impaired renal concentrating ability
Description: A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.

Label: Hydrocephalus
Synonyms: Too much cerebrospinal fluid in the brain|Nonsyndromal hydrocephalus|Hydrocephaly
Description: Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.

Label: Abnormal nervous system physiology
Description: A functional anomaly of the nervous system.

Label: Duplicated collecting system
Synonyms: Double collecting system|Double urinary collecting systems on intravenous pyelography|Duplex collecting system|Duplicated renal collecting system
Description: A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.

Label: Giant platelets
Description: Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).

Label: Congenital absence of portal vein
Description: Anomaly where the intestinal and the splenic venous drainage bypass the liver and drain into systemic veins through other possible venous shunts.

Label: Cephalohematoma
Description: Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum.

Label: Hydrocele testis
Description: Accumulation of clear fluid in the between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.

Label: Sydney crease
Description: Extension of the proximal transverse crease (five finger crease) to the ulnar edge of the palm.

Label: Accessory spleen
Description: An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.

Label: Ambiguous genitalia
Synonyms: Ambiguous external genitalia at birth|Intersex genitalia|Ambiguous external genitalia
Description: A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.

Label: Pulmonary sequestration
Description: The presence of a piece lung tissue which is not attached to the pulmonary blood supply and does not communicate with the other lung tissue (not connected to the standard bronchial airways and not performing a function in respiration).

Label: Adrenal calcification
Description: Calcification within the adrenal glands.

Label: Abnormal digit morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of fingers or toes|Abnormality of digit|Digital anomalies
Description: A morphological abnormality of a digit, i.e., of a finger or toe.

Label: Severe global developmental delay
Description: A severe delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

Label: Hemivertebrae
Description: Absence of one half of the vertebral body.

Label: Macrocephaly at birth
Synonyms: Large skull present since birth|Congenital large cranium|Large cranium present since birth|Head circumference large for gestational age|Big cranium present at birth|Large skull present at birth|Big skull present since birth|Big cranium present since birth|Large cranium present at birth|Congenital macrocephaly|Big skull present at birth|Congenital large skull
Description: The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.

Label: Uterus didelphys
Description: A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.

Label: Intrauterine growth retardation
Synonyms: Prenatal-onset growth retardation|Small for gestational age infant|Prenatal growth deficiency|Intrauterine growth restriction|Intrauterine retardation|Prenatal growth retardation|In utero growth retardation|IUGR|Prenatal growth failure|Intrauterine growth retardation, IUGR|Intrauterine growth failure|Prenatal onset growth retardation
Description: An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.

Label: Bifid scrotum
Description: Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.

Label: Shawl scrotum
Description: Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.

Label: Extralobar sequestration
Description: A kind of bronchopulmonary sequestration that is completely discrete from the normal lung and is surrounded by separate pleura.

Label: Overlapping toe
Description: Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest.

Label: Aplasia of the phalanges of the 3rd toe
Synonyms: Absent digital bone of the 3rd toe

Label: Camptodactyly
Synonyms: Permanent flexion of the finger or toe
Description: The distal interphalangeal joint and/or the proximal interphalangeal joint of the fingers or toes cannot be extended to 180 degrees by either active or passive extension.

Label: Lumbar kyphosis
Description: Over curvature of the lumbar region.

Label: Vertebral segmentation defect
Description: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.

Label: Ocular hypertension
Synonyms: Increased intraocular pressure|High eye pressure|Raised IOP|Elevated IOP|Increased IOP|Elevated intraocular pressure|Raised intraocular pressure
Description: Intraocular pressure that is 2 standard deviations above the population mean.

Label: Unilateral
Description: Being present on only the left or only the right side of the body.

Label: Scapular aplasia
Description: Absence of the scapulae.

Label: Upper limb muscle hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of muscles of the arm.

Label: 3-4 finger syndactyly
Synonyms: Webbed 3rd-4th finger|Webbed 3rd-4th fingers|Partial or complete syndactyly 3rd-4th fingers
Description: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three and four.

Label: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation of the lung
Synonyms: Congenital cystic disease of the lung|CCAM|Cystic adenomatoid lung disease
Description: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) can be diagnosed prenatally if ultrasound shows a cystic or solid lung tumor. A CCAM does not have systemic arterial blood supply (in contrast to bronchopulmonary sequenstration). It is a cystic area within the lung that originates from abnormal embryogenesis.

Label: Encephalopathy
Description: Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.

Label: Bilateral cleft lip and palate
Synonyms: Right and left cleft lip and palate|Bilateral cleft lip and cleft palate
Description: Cleft lip and cleft palate affecting both sides of the face.

Label: 4-5 toe syndactyly
Synonyms: Syndactyly of toes 4 and 5|Webbed 4th-5th toes|Symmetric syndactyly, toes 4 and 5
Description: Syndactyly with fusion of toes four and five.

Label: Crumpled long bones
Description: An crumpled radiographic appearance of the long bones, as if the long bone had been crushed together producing irregularities. This feature is the result of multiple fractures and repeated rounds of ineffective healing, as can be seen for instance in severe forms of osteogenesis imperfecta.

Label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
Synonyms: Absent outermost little finger bone|Absent outermost pinkie finger bone|Absent outermost pinky finger bone
Description: Absence of the distal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.

Label: Cervical spinal canal stenosis
Description: An abnormal narrowing of the cervical spinal canal.

Label: Esophageal stricture
Synonyms: Narrowing of esophagus due to inflammation and scar tissue
Description: A pathological narrowing of the esophagus that is caused by the development of a ring of scar tissue that constricts the esophageal lumen.

Label: Ectopia cordis
Description: Congenital malformation of the ventral wall with partial or total evisceration of the heart outside the thoracic cavity and through the defect in the ventral wall.

Label: Polysplenia
Synonyms: Accessory spleens|Multiple small spleens|Multiple accessory spleens
Description: Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.

Label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the thumb
Synonyms: Absent ossification/absent terminal thumb phalanx|Absence of the outermost bone of the thumb|Aplasia of the outermost bone of the thumb
Description: Absence of the distal/terminal phalanx of the thumb.

Label: Aplasia of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
Synonyms: Absent outermost index finger bone|Absent terminal index finger phalanx

Label: Anonychia
Description: Aplasia of the nail.

Label: Clinodactyly
Description: An angulation of a digit at an interphalangeal joint in the plane of the palm (finger) or sole (toe).

Label: Deviation of the hallux
Synonyms: Displacement of big toe|Displacement of the hallux
Description: Displacement of the big toe from its normal position.

Label: Single transverse palmar crease
Synonyms: Simian creases|Transverse palmar crease|Single palmar creases|Single flexion crease|Single palmar crease|Single transverse palmar creases|Simian crease|Simian line
Description: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.

Label: 3-5 finger syndactyly
Synonyms: Webbed third, fourth and fifth toes
Description: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers three to five.

Label: Tracheal duplication cyst
Description: A cyst in the trachea, whose wall is made up by tissue similar to the bronchial tree, including cartilage and smooth muscle, and is lined by secretory respiratory epithelium composed of cuboid or columnar ciliated epithelium.

Label: Bronchogenic cyst
Description: A rare congenital cystic lesion of the lungs in the mediastinum.

Label: Morphological abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
Synonyms: Morphological anomaly of the digestive system|Morphological abnormality of the GI tract|Abnormal shape of the digestive system
Description: Abnormal structure of the gastrointestinal tract.

Label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the spleen
Description: Absence or underdevelopment of the spleen.

Label: Postauricular skin tag
Synonyms: Skin tag behind the ear|Postauricular fibroepithelial polyp|Postauricular acrochordon
Description: A rudimentary tag of ear tissue often containing a core of cartilage and located just in back of the auricle (outer part of the ear).

Label: Osseous atresia of the external auditory canal

Joint laxity
Description: Lack of stability of a joint.

Label: Bilateral wrist flexion contracture
Description: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion on the right and left sides.

Label: Increased nuchal translucency
Description: The presence of an abnormally large hypoechoic space in the posterior fetal neck (usually detected on prenatal ultrasound examination).

Label: Radioulnar synostosis
Description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the ulna.

Label: 2-3 finger syndactyly
Description: Syndactyly with fusion of fingers two and three.

Label: Exudative pleural effusion
Description: A type of pleural effusion with a exudate (extravascular fluid that has exuded out of a tissue or its capillaries due to injury or inflammation). Pleural effusions can be classified as transudates or exudates based on Light's criteria, which classify an effusion as exudate if one or more of the following are present: (1) the ratio of pleural fluid protein to serum protein is greater than 0.5, (2) the ratio of pleural fluid lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) to serum LDH is greater than 0.6, or (3) the pleural fluid LDH level is greater than two thirds of the upper limit of normal for serum LDH.

Label: Truncus arteriosus
Description: A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.

Label: Supernumerary ribs
Description: The presence of more than 12 rib pairs.

Label: Small for gestational age
Synonyms: Low birth weight|Birth weight less than 10th percentile|Small for gestational age
Description: Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.

Label: Anomalous tracheal cartilage
Description: An abnormality of the C-shaped rings of hyaline cartilage, normally 16 to 20 in number, that occupy the anterior two-thirds of the circumference of the trachea (the posterior portion of the ring is completed by fibrous and smooth muscle tissue).

Label: Cleft lip
Description: A gap in the lip or lips.

Label: Coloboma
Description: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.

Label: Vertebral fusion
Synonyms: Fused vertebrae|Fusion of vertebral bodies|Vertebral body fusion|Spinal fusion
Description: A developmental defect leading to the union of two adjacent vertebrae.

Label: Enlarged kidney
Description: An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.

Label: Cleft soft palate
Synonyms: Cleft velum|Cleft muscular palate|Cleft of soft palate
Description: Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy.
