Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.

Label: Abnormality of the ear
Description: An abnormality of the ear.

Label: Abnormality of toe
Synonyms: Abnormality of toe|Abnormalities of the toes
Description: An anomaly of a toe.

Label: Abnormality of the ribs
Synonyms: Rib anomalies|Rib abnormalities|Abnormality of the ribs
Description: An anomaly of the rib.

Label: Abnormal thoracic spine morphology
Description: An abnormality of the thoracic vertebral column.

Label: Rocker bottom foot
Synonyms: Rocker-bottom feet|Rocker bottom foot|Rocker bottom feet|Rockerbottom feet|Congenital vertical talus
Description: The presence of both a prominent heel and a convex contour of the sole.

Label: Bronchopulmonary sequestration
Description: The presence of microscopic cystic masses of nonfunctioning pulmonary tissue that lack an obvious communication with the tracheobronchial tree.

Label: Seizure
Description: A seizure is an intermittent abnormality of nervous system physiology characterised by a transient occurrence of signs and/or symptoms due to abnormal excessive or synchronous neuronal activity in the brain.

Label: Chordee
Description: Ventral, lateral, or ventrolateral bowing of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.

Label: Neural tube defect
Description: A neural tube defect arises when the neural tube, the embryonic precursor of the brain and spinal cord, fails to close during neurulation. The cranial region (anencephaly) or the low spine (open spina bifida; myelomeningocele) are most commonly affected although, in the severe NTD craniorachischisis, almost the entire neural tube remains open, from midbrain to low spine.

Label: Madelung deformity
Description: An anomaly related to partial closure, or failure of development of the ulnar side of the distal radial growth plate, which results in an arrest of epiphyseal growth of the medial and volar portions of the distal radius. This leads to shortening of the radius and relative overgrowth of the ulna.

Label: Aplasia of the ovary
Description: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.

Label: Bicornuate uterus
Description: The presence of a bicornuate uterus.

Label: Abnormal lumbar spine morphology
Description: Any structural abnormality of the lumbar vertebral column.

Label: Abnormal sacrum morphology
Description: An abnormality of the sacral bone.

Label: Abnormal bone structure
Description: Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton.

Label: Abnormality of the diaphragm
Synonyms: Abnormality of the diaphragm|Diaphragmatic defect|Diaphragm issues
Description: Any abnormality of the diaphragm, the sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic cavity from the abdominal cavity.

Label: Growth delay
Synonyms: Delayed growth|Poor growth|Growth failure|Growth deficiency|Growth delay|Growth retardation|Retarded growth
Description: A deficiency or slowing down of growth pre- and postnatally.

Label: Abnormal localization of kidney
Description: An abnormal site of the kidney.

Label: Aplasia of the fallopian tube
Description: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the fallopian tube.

Label: Unicornuate uterus
Description: A uterus that has a single horn, with a banana-like shape that may or may not have a secondary rudimentary uterine horn.

Label: Bilateral single transverse palmar creases
Description: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands.

Label: Splenopancreatic fusion
Description: Fusion of the pancreatic tail and spleen.

Label: Thoracic hemivertebrae
Description: Absence of one half of the vertebral body in the thoracic spine.

Label: Fetal pyelectasis
Synonyms: Mild fetal hydronephrosis|Foetal pyelectasis|Fetal renal pelvic dilatation
Description: Mild pyelectasis is defined as a hypoechoic spherical or elliptical space within the renal pelvis that measures at least 5mm and not more than 10 mm. The measurement is taken on a transverse section through the fetal renal pelvis using the maximum anterior-to-posterior measurement.

Label: Ambiguous genitalia, male
Description: Ambiguous genitalia in an individual with XY genetic gender.

Label: Anomalous pulmonary venous return
Description: A developmental defect characterized by abnormal connection of one or more pulmonary veins to the superior or inferior vena cava, the right atrium, or the coronary sinus, resulting in a left-to-right shunt of oxygenated blood.

Label: Abnormality of the nervous system
Synonyms: Neurologic abnormalities|Abnormality of the nervous system|Neurological abnormality
Description: An abnormality of the nervous system.

Label: Crohn's disease
Description: A chronic granulomatous inflammatory disease of the intestines that may affect any part of the gastrointestinal tract from mouth to anus, causing a wide variety of symptoms. It primarily causes abdominal pain, diarrhea which may be bloody, vomiting, or weight loss, but may also cause complications outside of the gastrointestinal tract such as skin rashes, arthritis, inflammation of the eye, tiredness, and lack of concentration. Crohn's disease is thought to be an autoimmune disease, in which the body's immune system attacks the gastrointestinal tract, causing inflammation.

Label: Microcephaly
Synonyms: Small head circumference|Abnormally small cranium|Decreased size of skull|Abnormally small skull|Reduced head circumference|Decreased size of cranium|Decreased circumference of cranium|small calvarium|small cranium
Description: Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender.

Label: Growth hormone deficiency
Description: Insufficient production of growth hormone, which is produced by the anterior pituitary gland. Growth hormone is a major participant in control of growth and metabolism.

Label: Inguinal hernia
Description: Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.

Label: Abnormal vertebral pedicle morphology
Description: Abnormal morphology of a vertebral pedical.

Label: Dysplastic sacrum
Synonyms: Absence of some of the sacral and coccygeal bones|Partial sacral agenesis|Sacral dysgenesis
Description: A developmental defect of the sacrum characterized by partial or disordered development of the sacrum in which portions of the sacrum, which normally is formed by fusion of five sacral vertebrae S1-S5, fail to form or fail to form normally.

Label: Butterfly vertebrae
Synonyms: Anterior rachischisis|Sagittal clefting of vertebrae|Butterfly vertebrae
Description: A butterfly vertebra (sagittal cleft vertebra or anterior rachischisis) is a sagittal defect in the vertebral body caused by failure of fusion of the two lateral chondrification centers during embryogenesis. The name is based on the appearance of the two hemivertebrae emerging as butterfly wings from the central cleft on x-ray.

Label: Ventriculomegaly
Synonyms: Ventricular dilatation|Enlarged ventricular system|Enlarged ventricles|Dilated cerebral ventricles|Large cerebral ventricles and cisternae|Enlarged cerebral ventricles|Dilated ventricles|Dilated cerebral ventricle|Cerebral ventricular dilatation
Description: An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.

Label: Intestinal malrotation
Description: An abnormality of the intestinal rotation and fixation that normally occurs during the development of the gut. This can lead to volvulus, or twisting of the intestine that causes obstruction and necrosis.

Label: Pyloric stenosis
Description: An abnormal narrowing of the pylorus.

Label: Micrognathia
Synonyms: Small lower jaw|Mandibular deficiency|Hypotrophic mandible|Little lower jaw|Underdevelopment of lower jaw|Hypoplasia of lower jaw|Decreased size of mandible|Hypoplastic mandible condyle|Micrognathia of lower jaw|Mandibular micrognathia|Micromandible|Hypoplastic mandible|Mandibular retrusion|Decreased size of lower jaw|Hypotrophic lower jaw|Hypoplasia of mandible|Little mandible|Mandibular retrognathia|Lower jaw deficiency|Underdevelopment of mandible|Mandibular hypoplasia|Severe hypoplasia of mandible|Lower jaw hypoplasia|Robin mandible|Lower jaw retrusion|Small jaw|Small mandible
Description: Developmental hypoplasia of the mandible.

Label: Thoracoabdominal eventration
Description: Congenital protrusion of the abdominal or thoracic viscera, usually with a defect of the sternum and ribs as well as of the abdominal walls.

Label: Gastric duplication
Description: Gastric duplication is a usually cystic malformation of gastrointestinal tract, usually attached to the greater curvature of the stomach and has no communication with the stomach.

Label: Laryngeal web
Description: A membrane-like structure that extends across the laryngeal lumen close to the level of the vocal cords.

Label: Abnormal aortic morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the aorta|Abnormal aorta morphology
Description: An abnormality of the aorta.

Label: Abnormal atrial septum morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the atrial septum|Abnormal interatrial septum morphology
Description: An abnormality of the interatrial septum.

Label: Abnormal ventricular septum morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the ventricular septum|Ventricular septum abnormality|Abnormal interventricular septum morphology
Description: A structural abnormality of the interventricular septum.

Label: Conotruncal defect
Description: A congenital malformation of the outflow tract of the heart. Conotruncal defects are thought to result from a disturbance of the outflow tract of the embryonic heart, and comprise truncus arteriosus, tetralogy of Fallot, interrupted aortic arch, transposition of the great arteries, and double outlet right ventricle.

Label: Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the pulmonary valve|Anomaly of the pulmonary valve
Description: Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.

Label: Abnormal right ventricle morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the right ventricle|Right ventricular abnormality
Description: An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.

Label: Abnormal ventriculoarterial connection
Description: An abnormality of the circulatory connection between the ventricles and the pulmonary artery and aorta.

Label: Abnormal aortic valve morphology
Description: Any abnormality of the aortic valve.

Label: Abnormal left ventricle morphology
Synonyms: Left ventricular abnormality|Abnormal heart left ventricle morphology|Abnormality of the left ventricle
Description: Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.

Label: Abnormal mitral valve morphology
Description: Any structural anomaly of the mitral valve.

Label: Left ventricular outflow tract obstruction
Description: Left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) obstruction can occur at the valvular, subvalvular, or supravalvular level. In general, there is an obstruction to forward flow which increases afterload, and if untreated, can result in hypertrophy, dilatation, and eventual failure of the left ventricle.

Label: Abnormal renal cortex morphology
Description: An abnormality of the cortex of the kidney.

Label: Abnormal pulmonary artery morphology
Description: An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary artery.

Label: Abnormal venous morphology
Description: An anomaly of vein.

Label: Abnormal pulmonary vein morphology
Description: An abnormality of the structure of the pulmonary veins.

Label: Abnormal right atrium morphology
Description: Any structural abnormality of the right atrium.

Label: Abnormal atrioventricular connection
Description: An abnormality of the circulatory connection between atria and ventricles.

Label: Abnormal coronary artery morphology
Description: Any structural abnormality of the coronary arteries.

Label: Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology
Description: Any structural anomaly of the tricuspid valve.

Label: Abnormality of abdominal situs
Description: An abnormality of the abdominal situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the abdomen and its organs.

Label: Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature
Synonyms: Abnormality of liver blood vessels|Abnormality of the liver vasculature
Description: An abnormality of the hepatic vasculature.

Label: Abnormal left atrium morphology
Description: Any structural abnormality of the left atrium.

Label: Abnormal liver morphology
Description: Any structural anomaly of the bile-secreting organ that is important for detoxification, for fat, carbohydrate, and protein metabolism, and for glycogen storage.

Label: Asymmetric crying face
Synonyms: Asymmetric crying face|Partial unilateral facial paresis
Description: Asymmetry observed in the face of a neonate or infant whose face appears symmetric at rest and asymmetric during crying as the mouth is pulled downward on one side while not moving on the other side.

Label: Abnormality of the face
Synonyms: Abnormality of the face|Abnormal face|Facial abnormality
Description: An abnormality of the face.

Label: Thickened nuchal skin fold
Synonyms: Thickened nuchal skin|Thickened skin folds of neck|Increased nuchal fold thickness|Excess nuchal skin|Thickened skin over the neck
Description: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (PMID:16100637).

Label: Prominent occiput
Synonyms: Prominent posterior cranium|Protruding occiput|Prominent posterior skull|Prominent back of the skull
Description: Increased convexity of the occiput (posterior part of the skull).

Label: Short palpebral fissure
Synonyms: Short opening between the eyelids|Decreased height of palpebral fissure|Short palpebral fissures
Description: Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures.

Label: Sloping forehead
Synonyms: Inclined forehead|Receding forehead|Posteriorly sloping forehead|Sloping forehead
Description: Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view.

Label: Dolichocephaly
Synonyms: Tall and narrow skull|Long, narrow head
Description: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a increased anterior-posterior diameter, i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.

Label: Duane anomaly
Synonyms: Limited eye movement from Duane anomaly|Limited eye motility from Duane anomaly
Description: A condition associated with a limitation of the horizontal ocular movement with retraction of the globe and narrowing of the palpebral fissure on adduction

Label: Exotropia
Description: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward.

Label: Umbilical hernia
Description: Protrusion of abdominal contents through a defect in the abdominal wall musculature around the umbilicus. Skin and subcutaneous tissue overlie the defect.

Label: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
Description: Thickening of the left ventricle wall with congenital onset.

Label: Absent vertebra
Description: A developmental defect characterized by agenesis of one or more vertebral bodies.

Label: Absence of the sacrum
Description: Absence (aplasia) of the sacrum.

Label: 2-4 toe syndactyly
Synonyms: Syndactyly toes 2-4|Syndactyly of toes 2, 3 and 4|Webbed 2nd-4th toes
Description: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two to four.

Label: Contractures of the joints of the lower limbs
Hypoplastic pelvis
Description: Underdevelopment of the bony pelvis.

Label: Low-set ears
Description: Upper insertion of the ear to the scalp below an imaginary horizontal line drawn between the inner canthi of the eye and extending posteriorly to the ear.

Label: Wide intermamillary distance
Description: A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.

Label: Celiac disease
Description: Celiac disease (CD) is an autoimmune condition affecting the small intestine, triggered by the ingestion of gluten, the protein fraction of wheat, barley, and rye. Clinical manifestations of CD are highly variable and include both gastrointestinal and non-gastrointestinal features. The hallmark of CD is an immune-mediated enteropathy. This term is included because the occurence of CD is seen as a feature of a number of other diseases.

Label: Glaucoma
Description: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.

Label: Protein-losing enteropathy
Description: Abnormal loss of protein from the digestive tract related to excessive leakage of plasma proteins into the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract.

Label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
Synonyms: Absent/hypoplastic corpus callosum|Agenesis/hypoplastic corpus callosum|Hypoplastic or absent corpus callosum|Complete or partial absence of the corpus callosum|Hypoplasia or absence of the corpus callosum
Description: Absence or underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

Label: Tibial torsion
Description: Tibial torsion is inward twisting (medial rotation) (PATO:0002155) of the tibia.

Label: Tracheobronchomalacia
Description: Weakness of the cartilage in the trachea and the bronchi, resulting in a floppy (non-rigid) airway. Affected persons may have difficulties to maintain patency of the airways.

Label: Vocal cord paralysis
Synonyms: Laryngeal paralysis|Inability to move vocal cords
Description: A loss of the ability to move the vocal folds.

Label: Stridor
Description: Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway.

Label: Colonic atresia
Synonyms: Atresia of the large intestine|Large intestinal atresia
Description: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the colon. That is, there is an abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the colon.

Label: Malposition of the stomach
Description: Abnormal anatomical location of the stomach. This feature may be due to intestinal malrotation.

Label: Renal duplication
Description: A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.

Label: Arnold-Chiari malformation
Description: Arnold-Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow.

Label: Short phalanx of the 4th toe
Synonyms: Short 4th toe bone|Short phalanx of the fourth toe|Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the 4th toe
Description: Developmental hypoplasia of one or more phalanx of fourth toe.

Label: Short phalanx of the 5th toe
Synonyms: Short little toe bone|Short pinky toe bone|Short pinkie toe bone|Short phalanx of the fifth toe|Hypoplastic/small phalanges of the 5th toe
Description: Developmental hypoplasia of one or more phalanx of little toe.

Label: Missing ribs
Description: A developmental anomaly with absence of one or more ribs.

Label: Tracheoesophageal fistula
Description: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea.

Label: Esophagitis
Description: Inflammation of the esophagus.

Label: Cataract
Synonyms: Cataracts|Cloudy lens|Clouding of the lens of the eye|Lens opacities|Lens opacity
Description: A cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the crystalline lens of the eye or in its capsule.

Label: Congenital blindness
Description: Blindness with onset at birth.

Label: Abnormality of brain morphology
Synonyms: Abnormal shape of brain|Abnormality of the brain
Description: A structural abnormality of the brain, which has as its parts the forebrain, midbrain, and hindbrain.

Label: Atresia of the external auditory canal
Synonyms: Atretic external auditory canal|Atretic auditory canal|Atretic external auditory canals|External auditory meatal atresia|Auditory canal atresia|External acoustic meatus atresia|Absent external auditory canals|Atretic auditory canals|Absent ear canal|Absent auditory canals|External auditory meatus atresia|External auditory canal atresia
Description: Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.

Label: Short lingual frenulum
Synonyms: Deficiency of lingual frenulum|Short tongue frenulum|Short tongue frenum|Tight lingual frenulum|Short lingual frenum
Description: The presence of an abnormally short lingual frenulum.

Label: Torticollis
Description: Involuntary contractions of the neck musculature resulting in an abnormal posture of or abnormal movements of the head.

Label: Reduced factor XII activity
Description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XII. Factor XII (fXII) is part of the intrinsic coagulation pathway and binds to exposed collagen at site of vessel wall injury, activated by high-MW kininogen and kallikrein, thereby initiating the coagulation cascade.

Label: Pelvic kidney
Description: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.

Label: Asthma
Description: Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.

Label: Horner syndrome
Description: An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection.

Label: Hydronephrosis
Description: Severe distention of the kidney with dilation of the renal pelvis and calices.

Label: Vesicoureteral reflux
Description: Abnormal (retrograde) movement of urine from the bladder into ureters or kidneys related to inadequacy of the valvular mechanism at the ureterovesicular junction or other causes.

Label: Hepatomegaly
Description: Abnormally increased size of the liver.

Label: Abnormal sclera morphology
Description: An abnormality of the sclera.

Label: Blue sclerae
Synonyms: Bluish sclerae|Blue sclera|Whites of eyes are a bluish-gray color
Description: An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.

Label: Anteriorly placed anus
Description: Anterior malposition of the anus.

Label: Flat face
Synonyms: Flat facies|Flat face|Flat facial profile|Flat facial shape
Description: Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile.

Label: Hand polydactyly
Synonyms: Finger polydactyly|Extra finger|Polydactyly of the hand|Supernumerary finger
Description: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary finger or fingers.

Label: Retinoblastoma
Description: A tumor of the eye originating from cells of the retina.

Label: Scimitar anomaly
Description: Right pulmonary venous return to the inferior vena cava.

Label: Aplasia cutis congenita
Synonyms: Absence of part of skin at birth|Cutis aplasia|Congenital absence of skin
Description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin in multiple or solitary non-inflammatory, well-demarcated, oval or circular ulcers with a diameter of about 1 to 2 cm. Aplasia cutis congenita most commonly occurs on the scalp, but may present in the face, trunk, or limbs.

Label: Parietal encephalocele
Description: An encephalocele located between bregma and lambda.

Label: Narrow mouth
Description: Distance between the commissures of the mouth more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

Label: Thin upper lip vermilion
Synonyms: Decreased height of upper lip vermilion|Decreased volume of upper lip vermilion|Decreased volume of upper lip|Thin upper lip|Thin vermilion border of upper lip
Description: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).

Label: Unicoronal synostosis
Synonyms: Unilateral coronal suture craniosynostosis|Unilateral coronal suture synostosis
Description: Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures.

Label: Rectovaginal fistula
Synonyms: Abnormal connection between rectum and vagina
Description: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the rectum.

Label: Foot polydactyly
Synonyms: Polydactyly of the foot|Polydactyly of feet|Duplication of bones of the toes
Description: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary toe or toes.

Label: Mild global developmental delay
Description: A mild delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

Label: Agenesis of corpus callosum
Synonyms: Absent corpus callosum|Agenesis of the corpus callosum|Dysplastic or absent corpus callosum|Absence of corpus callosum|Corpus callosum agenesis|Callosal agenesis
Description: Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.

Label: Overfolding of the superior helices
Description: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.

Label: Gastroesophageal reflux
Synonyms: Acid reflux|GERD|Gastroesophageal reflux disease|Heartburn|Acid reflux disease
Description: A condition in which the stomach contents leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus through the lower esophageal sphincter.

Label: Spina bifida
Description: Incomplete closure of the embryonic neural tube, whereby some vertebral arches remain unfused and open. The mildest form is spina bifida occulta, followed by meningocele and meningomyelocele.

Label: Phimosis
Description: The male foreskin cannot be fully retracted from the head of the penis.

Label: Hyperbilirubinemia
Description: An increased amount of bilirubin in the blood.

Label: Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
Synonyms: Small corpus callosum|Thin corpus callosum|Underdevelopment of part of brain called corpus callosum|Thinning of the corpus callosum|Hypoplastic corpus callosum|Corpus callosum hypoplasia|Hypoplasia of corpus callosum
Description: Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.

Label: Hypothyroidism
Description: Deficiency of thyroid hormone.

Label: Prominent metopic ridge
Synonyms: Prominent frontal ridge|Ridging of metopic suture|Prominent metopic suture
Description: Vertical bony ridge positioned in the midline of the forehead.

Label: Small thenar eminence
Synonyms: Thenar hypoplasia|Decreased thenar eminence|Hypoplastic thenar eminences|Thenar muscle hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.

Label: Polycystic kidney dysplasia
Description: The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.

Label: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
Description: An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).

Label: Bulbar palsy
Description: Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.

Label: Sternocleidomastoid amyotrophy
Description: Wasting of the sternocleidomastoid muscle, the muscle in the anterior part of the neck that acts to flex and rotate the head.

Label: Short sternum
Description: Decreased inferosuperior length of the sternum.

Label: Webbed neck
Description: Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.

Label: Abnormal bronchus morphology
Description: Any anomaly of the morphology of the bronchi.

Label: Multilobulated spleen
Description: The fetal spleen is lobulated, and these lobules normally disappear before the birth. Lobulation of the spleen may persist into adult life and be typically seen along the medial part of the spleen. A persisting lobule results in a variation in shape of the spleen.

Label: Abnormality of the palpebral fissures
Synonyms: Abnormality of the opening between the eyelids|Abnormality of the palpebral fissures
Description: An anomaly of the space between the medial and lateral canthi of the two open eyelids.

Label: Short philtrum
Synonyms: Vertical hypoplasia of philtrum|Decreased vertical dimension of philtrum|Decreased length of philtrum|Decreased height of philtrum
Description: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.

Label: Thin vermilion border
Synonyms: Thin lips|Decreased volume of lip vermillion|Decreased volume of lip|Thin vermillion
Description: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).

Label: Narrow forehead
Synonyms: Intertemporal narrowing|Decreased width of the forehead|Temporal narrowness|Bitemporal skull narrowing|Narrow bitemporal diameter|Narrow forehead|Bitemporal narrowness|Bitemporal narrowing|Narrow bitemporal width
Description: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).

Label: Downslanted palpebral fissures
Synonyms: Downslanting palpebral fissures|Palpebral fissures down-slanted|Downward slanting of the opening between the eyelids|Down-slanted palpebral fissures|Down slanting palpebral fissures|Antimongoloid eye slant|Downward slanted palpebral fissures|Antimongoloid slanted palpebral fissures|Antimongoloid slant of palpebral fissures|Downslanting palpebral fissure|Down-slanting palpebral fissure|Downward slanting palpebral fissures|Downward-slanting palpebral fissures|Down-slanting palpebral fissures
Description: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.

Label: Hypotelorism
Synonyms: Decreased distance between eye sockets|Decreased distance between eyes|Ocular hypotelorism|Decreased orbital separation|Closely spaced eyes|Abnormally close eyes|Decreased interpupillary distance
Description: Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).

Label: Brachycephaly
Description: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a decreased anterior-posterior diameter. That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.

Label: Long eyelashes
Synonyms: Increased length of eyelashes|Ciliary trichomegaly|Unusually long eyelashes|Eyelash trichomegaly|Long eyelashes
Description: Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective).

Label: Midface retrusion
Synonyms: Flat midface|Decreased size of midface|Midface deficiency|Underdevelopment of midface|Midface hypoplasia|Retrusive midface|Midface, flat|Midface retrusion|Hypoplasia of midface
Description: Posterior positions and/or vertical shortening of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased concavity of the face and/or reduced nasolabial angle.

Label: Abnormally large globe
Description: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) without glaucoma.

Label: Abnormality of the neck
Synonyms: Abnormality of the neck|Anomaly of the neck
Description: An abnormality of the neck.

Label: Dry skin
Description: Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture.

Label: Small anterior fontanelle
Description: Abnormally decreased size of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.

Label: Glue ear
Description: Middle ear is filled with glue-like fluid instead of air.

Label: Chronic oral candidiasis
Description: Chronic accumulation and overgrowth of the fungus Candida albicans on the mucous membranes of the mouth, generally manifested as associated with creamy white lesions on the tongue or inner cheeks, occasionally spreading to the gums, tonsils, palate or oropharynx.

Label: Asymmetrical gluteal crease
Synonyms: Asymmetrical buttock crease|Asymmetrical gluteal sulcus|Asymmetrical horizontal gluteal crease
Description: The presence of an asymmetrical gluteal crease, the horizontal crease formed by the inferior aspect of the buttocks and the posterior upper leg.

Label: Decreased circulating antibody level
Synonyms: Decreased antibody level in blood|Decreased serum immunoglobulin|Reduced immunoglobulin levels|Decreased immunoglobulin level|Hypogammaglobulinemia|Immunoglobulin deficiency
Description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.

Label: Pulmonary lymphangiectasia
Description: Abnormal dilatation of the pulmonary lymphatic vessels. Lymphatic fluid in the lung is derived from normal leakage of fluid out of the blood capillaries in the lung. In pulmonary lymphangiectasia, the pulmonary lymphatics are not properly connected and become dilated with fluid.

Label: Telangiectasia
Description: Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.

Label: Abnormality of the pancreas
Description: An abnormality of the pancreas.

Label: Cupped ear
Description: Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).

Label: Proximal placement of thumb
Synonyms: Attachment of thumb close to wrist|Low implantation of the thumb|Proximally placed thumbs
Description: Proximal mislocalization of the thumb.

Label: Ileal atresia
Description: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the ileum.

Label: Abnormality of pulmonary circulation
Synonyms: Abnormality of respiratory circulation|Abnormal pulmonary circulation
Description: A functional anomaly of that portion of the cardiosvascular system that carries deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood back to the heart.

Label: Posteriorly rotated ears
Synonyms: Posteriorly angulated ears|Posteriorly-rotated ears|Posteriorly rotated auricles|Posteriorly rotated|Ear, posterior angulation, increased|Posteriorly-angulated ears|Ears rotated toward back of head
Description: A type of abnormal location of the ears in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).

Label: Short long bone
Synonyms: shortened long tubular bones|Short tubular bones|Long bone shortening|Short long bone
Description: One or more abnormally short long bone.

Label: Esophageal atresia
Synonyms: Birth defect in which part of esophagus did not develop
Description: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach.

Label: Opacification of the corneal stroma
Description: Reduced transparency of the stroma of cornea.

Label: Hypoplasia of the thymus
Description: Underdevelopment of the thymus.

Label: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
Synonyms: Attention deficit disorder|Childhood attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder|Attention deficits|Attention deficit|Attention deficit-hyperactivity disorder
Description: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) manifests at age 2-3 years or by first grade at the latest. The main symptoms are distractibility, impulsivity, hyperactivity, and often trouble organizing tasks and projects, difficulty going to sleep, and social problems from being aggressive, loud, or impatient.

Label: Pheochromocytoma
Description: Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines.

Label: Absent radius
Synonyms: Radial aplasia|Absent ossification/absence of radius|absence of radius and ulna|Aplasia of the radius|Missing outer large bone of forearm
Description: Missing radius bone associated with congenital failure of development.

Label: Intraretinal hemorrhage
Description: A subtype of fundus hemorrhage occurring within the neurosensory retina. Intraretinal haemorrhages may be 'dot' or' blot' shaped or flame shaped depending upon their depth within the retina.

Label: Congenital hypothyroidism
Synonyms: Underactive thyroid gland from birth|Hypothyroidism, congenital
Description: A type of hypothyroidism with congenital onset.

Label: Hypercholesterolemia
Synonyms: Elevated serum cholesterol|Elevated total cholesterol|Increased total cholesterol
Description: An increased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

Label: Abnormality of calvarial morphology
Synonyms: Abnormally shaped skull|Abnormal cranium morphology|Abnormality of the shape of calvarium|Abnormality of the shape of cranium|Abnormality of cranial bone morphology
Description: The presence of an abnormal shape of the calvaria (skullcap), that is, of that part of the skull that is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones and covers the cranial cavity that contains the brain.

Label: Proptosis
Synonyms: Protrusio bulbi|Eyeballs bulging out|Prominent eyes|Exophthalmos|Anterior bulging of the globe of eye|Bulging eye|Prominent globes|Protruding eyes|Anterior bulging of the globe|Ocular proptosis
Description: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.

Label: Pancreatitis
Description: The presence of inflammation in the pancreas.

Label: Kyphoscoliosis
Description: An abnormal curvature of the spine in both a coronal (lateral) and sagittal (back-to-front) plane.

Label: Developmental stagnation
Description: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills.

Label: Muscle stiffness
Description: A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.

Label: Amblyopia
Description: Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.

Label: Esotropia
Description: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes turned inward ('crossed') to a relatively severe degree, usually defined as 10 diopters or more.

Label: Neurogenic bladder
Synonyms: Lack of bladder control due to nervous system injury
Description: A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.

Label: Tethered cord
Description: During normal embryological development, the spinal cord first occupies the entire length of the vertebral column but goes on to assume a position at the level of L1 due to differential growth of the conus medullaris and the vertebral column. The filum terminale is a slender, threadlike structure that remains after the normal regression of the distal embryonic spinal cord and attaches the spinal cord to the coccyx. A tethered cord results if there is a thickened rope-like filum terminale which anchors the cord at the level of L2 or below, potentially causing neurologic signs owing to abnormal tension on the spinal cord.

Label: Aplasia of the thymus
Description: Absence of the thymus. This feature may be appreciated by the lack of a thymic shadow upon radiographic examination.

Label: Atelectasis
Synonyms: Partial or complete collapse of part or entire lung|Pulmonary atelectasis
Description: Collapse of part of a lung associated with absence of inflation (air) of that part.

Label: Hypoglycemia
Description: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

Label: Hypoparathyroidism
Synonyms: Decreased parathyroid hormone secretion|Low parathyroid hormone
Description: A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.

Label: Hypocalcemic seizures
Synonyms: Low calcium seizures|Seizures due to hypocalcemia

Label: Low levels of vitamin D
Synonyms: Vitamin D deficiency|Deficient in vitamin D
Description: A reduced concentration of Vitamin D.

Label: Anemia
Synonyms: Anaemia|Low number of red blood cells or hemoglobin
Description: A reduction in erythrocytes volume or hemoglobin concentration.

Label: Chronic lung disease
Description: According to the definitions of the American and British Thoracic Societies, including pulmonary functional tests, X-rays, and CT scans for items such as fibrosis, bronchiectasis, bullae, emphysema, nodular or lymphomatous abnormalities.

Label: Retinopathy of prematurity
Description: An avascular or abnormally vascularized retina that occurs in premature infants and can lead to blindness.

Label: Delayed puberty
Synonyms: Delayed pubertal growth|Delayed puberty|Pubertal delay|Delayed pubertal development
Description: Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty.

Label: Autistic behavior
Description: Persistent deficits in social interaction and communication and interaction as well as a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest as well as repetitive patterns of behavior.

Label: Absent speech
Synonyms: Absent speech development|No speech development|Lack of language development|No speech or language development|Nonverbal|Lack of speech
Description: Complete lack of development of speech and language abilities.

Label: Abnormality of the pinna
Synonyms: Minor malformation of the auricles|Auricular malformation|Deformed ears|Malformed ears|Malformation of auricle|Malformed auricles|Malformed external ears|Abnormal form of ears|Poorly defined conchae|Dysplastic ears|Deformed auricles|Abnormally shaped ears
Description: An abnormality of the pinna, which is also referred to as the auricle or external ear.

Label: Cervical C2/C3 vertebral fusion
Synonyms: Klippel-Feil anomaly|Klippel-Feil syndrome|Fusion of cervical vertebrae c2-3
Description: Fusion of cervical vertebrae at C2 and C3, caused by a failure in the normal segmentation or division of the cervical vertebrae during the early weeks of fetal development, leading to a short neck with a low hairline at the back of the head, and restricted mobility of the upper spine.

Label: Broad hallux
Synonyms: Broad big toe|Wide big toe|Broad great toes|Abnormally broad great toes|Broad great toe|Broad halluces
Description: Visible increase in width of the hallux without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.

Label: High palate
Synonyms: Elevated palate|High palate|Palate high-arched|Increased palatal height|High, arched palate|High-arched palate|High arched palate|Palate, high-arched
Description: Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).

Label: Cafe-au-lait spot
Synonyms: Cafe-au-lait macule|Cafe au lait spots|Cafe-au-lait macules
Description: Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.

Label: Abnormal thumb morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the thumbs|Thumb deformity|Abnormality of the thumb
Description: An abnormal structure of the first digit of the hand.

Label: Nystagmus
Description: Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.

Label: Anxiety
Description: Intense feelings of nervousness, tenseness, or panic, often in reaction to interpersonal stresses; worry about the negative effects of past unpleasant experiences and future negative possibilities; feeling fearful, apprehensive, or threatened by uncertainty; fears of falling apart or losing control.

Label: Juvenile rheumatoid arthritis
Synonyms: Juvenile RA|Rheumatoid arthritis, juvenile|Juvenile idiopathic arthritis

Label: Clubbing
Synonyms: Digital clubbing|Clubbing of fingers and toes
Description: Broadening of the soft tissues (non-edematous swelling of soft tissues) of the digital tips in all dimensions associated with an increased longitudinal and lateral curvature of the nails.

Label: Global developmental delay
Synonyms: Retarded psychomotor development|Psychomotor delay|Retarded development|Developmental delay, global|Psychomotor developmental delay|Developmental retardation|Delayed cognitive development|Delayed developmental milestones|Retarded mental development|Psychomotor development deficiency|Delayed development|Developmental delay|Delayed milestones|Delayed psychomotor development|Developmental delay in early childhood|Motor and developmental delay|Psychomotor development failure|Lack of psychomotor development|Delayed intellectual development
Description: A delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child, including motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and emotional skills. This term should only be used to describe children younger than five years of age.

Label: Generalized hypotonia
Synonyms: Generalized muscular hypotonia|Low muscle tone|Generalised hypotonia|Hypotonia, generalized|Decreased muscle tone
Description: Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone).

Label: Clinodactyly of the 5th toe
Description: Bending or curvature of a fifth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

Label: Elevated coagulation factor V activity
Synonyms: Plasma factor V elevated|Elevated factor V activity
Description: Increased activity of coagulation factor V, Factor V, which is activated to factor Va by means of minute amounts of thrombin (and inactivated by larger amounts of thrombin). Activated factor V (fVa) is a cofactor in the formation of the prothrombinase complex.

Label: Male urethral meatus stenosis
Description: An abnormal narrowing of the urethral opening (meatus) of the penis.

Label: Asymmetric growth
Synonyms: Uneven or disproportionate growth of one body part compared to another
Description: A growth pattern that displays an abnormal difference between the left and the right side.

Label: Overfolded helix
Description: A condition in which the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal. That is, excessive curling of the helix edge, whereby the free edge is parallel to the plane of the ear.

Label: Upslanted palpebral fissure
Synonyms: Upward slanting palpebral fissures|Upward slanted palpebral fissures|Upslanting palpebral fissures|Upward slanting of the opening between the eyelids|Mongoloid slant|Upward slanting of palpebral fissures
Description: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age.

Label: Upper limb muscle weakness
Description: Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

Label: Renal insufficiency
Description: A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.

Label: Achilles tendon contracture
Synonyms: Tight achilles tendon|Shortening of the achilles tendon|Contractures of the Achilles tendon|Achilles tendon contractures
Description: A contracture of the Achilles tendon.

Label: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
Synonyms: Abnormality of the abdominal wall|Abnormality of external features of the abdomen
Description: The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.

Label: Thickened helices
Description: Increased thickness of the helix of the ear.

Label: Dilatation of renal calices
Description: An abnormal enlargement of the renal calices, the system of ducts of the kidney that collect urine.

Label: Delayed gross motor development
Synonyms: Delayed gross motor skills|Developmental delay, gross motor|Gross motor delay|Limited gross motor development|Delayed motor skills
Description: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the large muscles of the body for walking, running, sitting, and crawling.

Label: Central hypothyroidism
Description: A type of hypothyroidism due to an insufficient stimulation of an otherwise normal thyroid gland. Central hypothyroidism is caused by either pituitary (secondary hypothyroidism) or hypothalamic (tertiary hypothyroidism) defects.

Label: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism
Description: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

Label: Preauricular pit
Synonyms: Preauricular fistulas|Preauricular pits|Pit in front of the ear|Preauricular sinus|Ear pit|Preauricular earpits
Description: Small indentation anterior to the insertion of the ear.

Label: Thrombocytopenia
Description: A reduction in the number of circulating thrombocytes.

Label: Low levels of vitamin K
Description: A reduced concentration of vitamin K.

Label: Abnormality of the auditory canal
Description: An abnormality of the External acoustic tube (also known as the auditory canal).

Label: Abnormality of the mouth
Description: An abnormality of the mouth.

Label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the mandible
Description: Absence or underdevelopment of the mandible.

Label: Extra fontanelles
Description: Bony defects situated along the cranial suture lines or at the junction of the bone plates of the skull.

Label: Labial hypertrophy
Synonyms: Enlargement of the vaginal lips|Enlargement of the labia|Enlarged vaginal lips

Label: Long ear
Description: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.

Label: Macrotia
Description: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).

Label: Ureter duplex
Description: A complete duplication of the ureter, where the duplicated ureters have separate insertions into the bladder.

Label: Pulmonary situs inversus
Description: Mirror image arrangement of the mainstem bronchi with the right pulmonary artery posterior to the right upper lobe bronchus and the left pulmonary artery anterior to the left upper lobe bronchus.

Label: Sandal gap
Synonyms: Space between great toe and second toe|Wide-spaced big toe|Widened gap 1st-2nd toes|Widened gap first and second toe|Wide space between 1st, 2nd toes|Wide space between first and second toes|Gap between 1st and 2nd toes|Sandal gap between first and second toes|Widely spaced first and second toes|Increased space between first and second toes|Widely spaced 1st-2nd toes|Gap between first and second toe
Description: A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.

Label: Choroid plexus cyst
Description: A cyst occurring within the choroid plexus within a cerebral ventricle.

Label: Abnormality of the labia
Description: An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.

Label: Auricular tag
Description: Small protrusion within the pinna.

Label: Shallow acetabular fossae
Synonyms: Shallow acetabular fossa|Shallow acetabulum|Shallow acetabulae|Shallow acetabula

Label: Syringomyelia
Description: Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

Label: Osteopenia
Description: Osteopenia is a term to define bone density that is not normal but also not as low as osteoporosis. By definition from the World Health Organization osteopenia is defined by bone densitometry as a T score -1 to -2.5.

Label: Hyperpigmentation of the skin
Synonyms: Skin hyperpigmentation|Cutaneous hyperpigmentation|Patchy darkened skin|Hyperpigmented lesion|Increased skin pigmentation
Description: A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition.

Label: Tapered finger
Synonyms: Tapered finger|Tapered fingertips|Distally tapering fingers|Tapering fingers
Description: The gradual reduction in girth of the finger from proximal to distal.

Label: Thickened ribs
Description: Increased thickness (diameter) of ribs.

Label: Cerebral palsy
Description: Cerebral palsy describes a group of permanent disorders of the development of movement and posture, causing activity limitation, that are attributed to nonprogressive disturbances that occurred in the developing fetal or infant brain. The motor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, communication, and behaviour, by epilepsy, and by secondary musculoskeletal problems.

Label: Abnormality of the cervical spine
Synonyms: Disorder of cervical vertebra|Cervical vertebral abnormalities|Abnormality of cervical vertebra|Abnormality of the cervical vertebrae|Cervical spine abnormalities|Abnormal cervical spine
Description: Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

Label: Hypoplastic right heart
Synonyms: Underdeveloped right heart|Hypoplastic right heart syndrome
Description: Underdevelopment of the right-sided structures of the heart.

Label: Ridged cranial sutures
Description: An overlap of the bony plates of the skull in an infant, with or without early closure.

Label: Annular pancreas
Description: A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.

Label: Aplasia/Hypoplasia of the thumb
Synonyms: Absent/hypoplastic thumb|Absent/underdeveloped thumb|Absent/hypoplastic thumbs|Hypoplastic to aplastic thumbs|Thumb aplasia/hypoplasia|Absent/small thumb|Absent or hypoplastic thumbs|Aplastic/hypoplastic thumbs|Aplasia/hypoplasia of thumbs|Hypoplastic/absent thumb
Description: Hypoplastic/small or absent thumb.

Label: Hamartoma
Description: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that is native to the site of origin, e.g., exostoses, nevi and soft tissue hamartomas. Although most hamartomas are benign, some histologic subtypes, e.g., neuromuscular hamartoma, may proliferate aggressively such as mesenchymal cystic hamartoma, Sclerosing epithelial hamartoma, Sclerosing metanephric hamartoma.

Label: Bitemporal hollowing
Description: Depression of profile in both temporal regions.

Label: Morgagni diaphragmatic hernia
Description: An anterior retrosternal or parasternal hernia that can result in the herniation of liver or intestines into the chest cavity.

Label: Displacement of the urethral meatus
Synonyms: Displacement of the external urethral orifice|Displacement of the male external urethral orifice
Description: A displacement of the external urethral orifice from its normal position (in males normally placed at the tip of glans penis, in females normally placed about 2.5 cm behind the glans clitoridis and immediately in front of that of the vagina).

Label: Abnormality of the helix
Description: An abnormality of the helix. The helix is the outer rim of the ear that extends from the insertion of the ear on the scalp (root) to the termination of the cartilage at the earlobe.

Label: Rectourethral fistula
Description: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the rectum and the urethra.

Label: Hypertonia
Description: A condition in which there is increased muscle tone so that arms or legs, for example, are stiff and difficult to move.

Label: Hallux valgus
Synonyms: Lateral deviation of great toe|Bunion|Lateral deviation of halluces
Description: Lateral deviation of the great toe (i.e., in the direction of the little toe).

Label: Macroglossia
Synonyms: Hyperplasia of the tongue|Tongue hypertrophy|Hypertrophy of the tongue|Large tongue|Abnormally large tongue|Increased size of tongue
Description: Increased length and width of the tongue.

Label: Myopia
Description: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.

Label: Abnormal renal physiology
Synonyms: Abnormal renal function|Abnormal kidney function|Renal functional abnormality|Kidney function issue|Abnormality of renal physiology
Description: An abnormal functionality of the kidney.

Label: Bladder outlet obstruction
Description: A compression or resistance upon the bladder outflow channel at any location from the bladder neck to urethral meatus, which usually causes lower urinary tract symptoms (LUTS).

Label: Abnormality of the ureter
Synonyms: Abnormality of the ureters|Ureter issue|Ureteral anomalies
Description: An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

Label: Abnormal conus terminalis morphology
Description: Any structural anomaly of the conus terminalis, which is the distal bulbous part of the spinal cord at the location where the spinal cord tapers and ends (usually between the L1 and L2 lumbar vertebrae).

Label: Rectovestibular fistula
Description: A congenital malformation characterized by an abnormal connection (fistula) between the rectum and the vulval vestibule, at the lower aspect of the vaginal opening.

Label: Gait disturbance
Synonyms: Gait abnormalities|Gait disturbances|Gait difficulties|Abnormal gait|Abnormal walk|Impaired gait
Description: The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease.

Label: Squared superior portion of helix
Description: Flattening instead of curving or rounded superior helix, allowing the superior helix to run more horizontally than usual.

Label: Abnormality of the eye
Description: Any abnormality of the eye, including location, spacing, and intraocular abnormalities.

Label: Stroke
Description: Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.

Label: Polydactyly
Synonyms: More than five fingers or toes on hands or feet
Description: A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of supernumerary fingers or toes.

Label: Moderately reduced visual acuity
Synonyms: Moderate visual impairment|Moderate vision loss|Moderate reduction in visual acuity|Moderate visual loss
Description: Moderate reduction of the ability to see defined as visual acuity less than 6/18 (20/60 in US notation; 0.5 in decimal notation) but at least 6/60 (20/200 in US notation; 0.1 in decimal notation).

Label: High, narrow palate
Synonyms: Narrow, highly arched palate|Narrow, high-arched roof of mouth|Narrow, highly arched roof of mouth|High vaulted palate|Gothic palate|Narrow, high-arched palate|High, narrow palate|Narrow and high arched palate|High narrow palate
Description: The presence of a high and narrow palate.

Label: Multiple renal cysts
Description: The presence of many cysts in the kidney.

Label: Retinal hamartoma
Description: A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.

Label: Abnormal chromosome morphology
Description: Any structural anomaly of a chromosome, which is a thread like molecule consisting of DNA and proteins (chromatin) that contains DNA sequences for genes and other genetic elements in linear order.

Label: Abnormality of facial skeleton
Synonyms: Abnormality of facial skeleton|Anomaly of facial skeleton
Description: An abnormality of one or more of the set of bones that make up the facial skeleton.

Label: Abnormal skull morphology
Description: An abnormality of the skull, the bony framework of the head which is comprised of eight cranial and fourteen facial bones.

Label: Abnormal ear morphology
Description: Any structural anomaly of the ear.

Label: Cerebral arteriovenous malformation
Description: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the brain.

Label: Epiblepharon
Description: Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva.

Label: Velopharyngeal insufficiency
Description: Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.

Label: Megalencephaly
Description: Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).

Label: Large fontanelles
Synonyms: Enlarged fontanelles|Large fontanelle|Large fontanels|Persistent wide fontanel|Large fontanel|Wide fontanelles
Description: In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.

Label: Abnormality of the spinal cord
Description: An abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).

Label: Abnormal intestine morphology
Description: An abnormality of the intestine. The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.

Label: Pulmonary artery hypoplasia
Description: Underdevelopment of the pulmonary artery.

Label: Abnormality of the urachus
Description: Abnormality of the urachus.

Label: Pes planus
Description: A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.

Label: Abnormality of the spleen
Description: An abnormality of the spleen.

Label: Developmental cataract
Synonyms: Congenital cataracts|Congenital cataract|Cataract, congenital|Congenital cataracts, bilateral|Bilateral congenital cataracts|Clouding of the lens of the eye at birth
Description: A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.

Label: Abnormality of the optic disc
Description: A morphological abnormality of the optic disc, i.e., of the portion of the optic nerve clinically visible on fundoscopic examination.

Label: Submucous cleft hard palate
Synonyms: Partial thickness cleft hard palate|Submucosal cleft palate
Description: Hard-palate submucous clefts are characterized by bony defects in the midline of the bony palate that are covered by the mucous membrane of the roof of the mouth. It may be possible to detect a submucous cleft hard palate upon palpation as a notch in the bony palate.

Label: Oral cleft
Description: The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately.

Label: Branchial cyst
Description: A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region.

Label: Discordant atrioventricular connection
Description: Connection of the right atrium to the left ventricle and of the left atrium to the right ventricle in a biventricular heart.

Label: Situs inversus totalis
Synonyms: situs oppositus|All organs on wrong side of body|situs transversus
Description: A left-right reversal (or "mirror reflection") of the anatomical location of the major thoracic and abdominal organs.

Label: Laryngomalacia
Description: Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.

Label: Abnormality of the vertebral column
Synonyms: Abnormal vertebral column|Abnormality of the spine|Abnormality of the vertebral column|Abnormal spine
Description: Any abnormality of the vertebral column.

Label: Abnormal aortic arch morphology
Description: An anomaly of the arch of aorta.

Label: Congenital hip dislocation
Synonyms: Dislocated hip since birth|Congenital dislocation of the hip|Congenital hip dislocations|Congenital dislocation of the hips|Congenital hip anomaly

Label: Congenital muscular torticollis
Description: A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending.

Label: Hemimegalencephaly
Description: Enlargement of all or parts of one cerebral hemisphere.

Label: Lipomeningocele
Description: A form of closed neural tube defect in which the spinal tissue lies within the spinal cord having a junction between the spinal cord and the lipoma. Intact skin covers the defect. Neurologic findings first appear during the second year of life.

Label: Lipomyelomeningocele
Description: A type of spinal dysraphism presenting as a subcutaneous fatty mass, that is, a spinal defect associated with lipomatous tissue, and covered by skin. The most usual location for lipomyelomeningocele is at the gluteal cleft.

Label: Spina bifida occulta
Description: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin.

Label: Cavernous hemangioma
Synonyms: Collection of dilated blood vessels that forms mass|Cavernous haemangioma|Cavernous angioma
Description: The presence of a cavernous hemangioma. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma.

Label: Stenosis of the external auditory canal
Synonyms: Stenotic external auditory canal|Narrowing of passageway from outer ear to middle ear|Narrow external auditory meatus|Narrow external auditory canals|External auditory canal stenosis|Narrow auditory canals
Description: An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.

Label: Abnormality of the urinary system
Synonyms: Urinary tract anomalies|Urinary tract abnormalities|Urinary tract abnormality
Description: An abnormality of the urinary system.

Label: Iris coloboma
Synonyms: Coloboma of the iris|Coloboma of iris|Cat eye|Keyhole iris
Description: A coloboma of the iris.

Label: Abnormality of the adrenal glands
Description: Abnormality of the adrenal glands, i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.

Label: Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia
Description: Fibrous dysplasia of the bones were lesions are localized in many bones throughout of the body. Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia is a cardinal feature of McCune-Albright syndrome.

Label: Abnormality of the inner ear
Synonyms: Abnormality of the inner ear|Inner ear abnormality
Description: An abnormality of the inner ear.

Label: Ectrodactyly
Description: A condition in which middle parts of the hands and/or feet (digits and meta-carpals and -tarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe/fingers over absent 2nd or 3rd toes/fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands and/or feet.

Label: Subvalvular aortic stenosis
Synonyms: Narrowing of blood vessel below aortic heart valve|Subaortic stenosis
Description: A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.

Label: Developmental glaucoma
Description: Glaucoma which forms during the early years of a child's life is called developmental or congenital glaucoma.

Label: Open angle glaucoma
Description: A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,

Label: Ureteral duplication
Description: A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.

Label: Protruding ear
Description: Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).

Label: Transposition of the great arteries
Description: A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.

Label: Hydromyelia
Description: Dilation of central canal from incomplete fusion of the posterior columns or persistence of the primitive large canal of the embryo.

Label: Congenital mitral stenosis
Description: Mitral stenosis with congenital onset.

Label: Aortic valve stenosis
Synonyms: Aortic stenosis|Valvular aortic stenosis|Narrowing of aortic valve
Description: The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.

Label: Myeloschisis
Description: The severe form of a neural tube defect where the open neural tube appears as a flattened, plate-like mass of nervous tissue with no overlying membrane.

Label: Complete atrioventricular canal defect
Synonyms: Complete atrioventricular septal defect|Atrioventricular canal|Complete common AV canal|Common atrioventricular canal
Description: A congenital heart defect characteizred by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.

Label: Partial atrioventricular canal defect
Description: A specific combination of heart defects including a primum atrial septal defect and cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet. There is not an inlet ventricular septal defect present. There are two valve annuluses and two valve orifices.

Label: Abnormality of skin pigmentation
Synonyms: Abnormality of skin pigmentation|Abnormal skin color|Abnormal skin pigmentation|Pigmentation anomaly|Pigmentary skin changes|Abnormality of pigmentation|Abnormal pigmentation|Pigmentary changes
Description: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin.

Label: Wide anterior fontanel
Synonyms: Large open anterior fontanelle|Large anterior fontanelle|Wider-than-typical soft spot of skull|Large open anterior fontanel|Large anterior fontanel|Wide anterior fontanelle|Wide open anterior fontanelle
Description: Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.

Label: Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation
Description: Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation, a condition most commonly associated with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia, is an abnormal communication between the pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary communication. HRCT images usually show a coarse spidery appearance of the peripheral vascular markings in the lungs. More specific findings are obtained in the pulmonary angiogram where the normally invisible capillary phase is replaced by irregular vascular channels bridging the peripheral branches of pulmonary arteries and veins.

Label: Abnormality of the upper limb
Synonyms: Abnormality of the arm|Abnormality of the upper limb
Description: An abnormality of the arm.

Label: Talipes
Description: A deformity of foot and ankle that has different subtypes that are talipes equinovarus, talipes equinovalgus, talipes calcaneovarus and talipes calcaneovalgus.

Label: Mitral regurgitation
Synonyms: Mitral insufficiency|Mitral valve regurgitation|Mitral incompetence|Mitral valve insufficiency
Description: An abnormality of the mitral valve characterized by insufficiency or incompetence of the mitral valve resulting in retrograde leaking of blood through the mitral valve upon ventricular contraction.

Label: Optic nerve coloboma
Synonyms: Coloboma of optic nerve|Optic disk coloboma
Description: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.

Label: Thoracolumbar kyphosis
Description: Hyperconvexity of the thoracolumbar spine producing a rounded or humped appearance.

Label: Abnormal corpus callosum morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the corpus callosum|Abnormal corpus callosum|Corpus callosum abnormality
Description: Abnormality of the corpus callosum.

Label: Pes cavus
Description: The presence of an unusually high plantar arch. Also called high instep, pes cavus refers to a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight.

Label: Basilar invagination
Description: Projection of the tip of the dens more than 5 mm above a line joining the hard palate to the posterior lip of the foramen magnum (Chamberlain's line) or the tip of the dens is greater than 7 mm above McGregor's line (the back of the hard palate to the lowest point of the occipital squama).

Label: Hemihypertrophy
Description: Overgrowth of only one side of the body.

Label: Morphological abnormality of the inner ear
Description: A structural anomaly of the internal part of the ear.

Label: Choanal atresia
Synonyms: Obstruction of the rear opening of the nasal cavity|Blockage of the rear opening of the nasal cavity
Description: Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).

Label: Abnormality of the ovary
Synonyms: Abnormality of the ovary|Abnormality of the ovaries
Description: An abnormality of the ovary.

Label: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
Description: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

Label: Capsular cataract
Description: A cataract that affects the capsule of the lens.

Label: Subcapsular cataract
Description: A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the capsule of the lens.

Label: Anophthalmia
Synonyms: No globe of eye|Absence of eyeballs|Missing eyeball|Missing globe of eye|Absence of globes of eyes|Anophthalmia, clinical|Clinical anophthalmia, unilateral/bilateral|Failure of development of eyeball|No eyeball|Ocular absence
Description: Absence of the globe or eyeball.

Label: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
Description: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.

Label: Posterior fossa cyst
Description: A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.

Label: Abnormality of the hip joint
Description: An abnormality of the hip joint.

Label: Neurenteric cyst
Description: The neurenteric cyst is a rare lesion composed of heterotopic endodermal tissue. During the third week of human embryogenesis, the neurenteric canal unites the yolk sac and the amniotic cavity as it traverses the primitive notochordal plate. Persistence of the normally transient neurenteric canal prevents appropriate separation of endoderm and notochord. This results in a variable degree of communication between neural and enteric epithelium.

Label: Pulmonary artery atresia
Description: A congenital anomaly with a narrowing or complete absence of the opening between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.

Label: Webbed penis
Description: Ventral skinfold extending from penis to scrotum.

Label: Abnormality of the os naviculare pedis
Short lower limbs
Description: Shortening of the legs related to developmental hypoplasia of the bones of the leg.

Label: Cleft earlobe
Description: Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe.

Label: Abnormality of the vasculature
Synonyms: Vascular abnormalities|Abnormality of blood vessels|Abnormality of the vasculature
Description: An abnormality of the vasculature.

Label: Nasolacrimal duct obstruction
Description: Blockage of the lacrimal duct.

Label: Abnormality of the integument
Description: An abnormality of the integument, which consists of the skin and the superficial fascia.

Label: Abnormal hair morphology
Description: An abnormality of the hair.

Label: Prominent forehead
Synonyms: Protruding forehead|Prominence of frontal region|Pronounced forehead|Prominent forehead
Description: Forward prominence of the entire forehead, due to protrusion of the frontal bone.

Label: Thyroglossal cyst
Description: An abnormality of the thyroid gland owing to the presence of a fibrous cyst resulting from the persistence of the thyroglossal duct.

Label: Pulmonary cyst
Description: A round circumscribed space within a lung that is surrounded by an epithelial or fibrous wall of variable thickness. A cyst usually has a thin and regular wall (less than 2 mm) and contains air, although some may contain fluid.

Label: Abnormal skeletal muscle morphology
Synonyms: Abnormally shaped muscle|Issue with muscle structure|Abnormal muscle morphology|Abnormality of muscle morphology
Description: A structural abnormality of a skeletal muscle.

Label: Pedal edema
Synonyms: Edema of the lower limbs|Fluid accumulation in lower limbs|Lower leg swelling|Leg edema|Pedal oedema|Peripheral edema of lower extremity
Description: An abnormal accumulation of excess fluid in the lower extremity resulting in swelling of the feet and extending upward to the lower leg.

Label: Abnormality of tibia morphology
Synonyms: Abnormality of the shankbone|Abnormality of the shinbone
Description: Abnormality of the tibia (shinbone).

Label: Tibial pseudarthrosis
Description: Pseudarthrosis, or "false joint" of the tibia is the result of a developmental failure in the tibia progressing to spontaneous fracture and subsequent fibrous nonunion. The fracture is rarely present at birth but commonly develops during the first 18 months of life.
